Job_Descriptions: Colliers International Group Inc. (NASDAQ and TSX: CIGI) is an industry-leading global real estate services company with 15,000 skilled professionals operating in 68 countries. With an enterprising culture and significant employee ownership, Colliers professionals provide a full range of services to real estate occupiers, owners and investors worldwide. Services include strategic advice and execution for property sales, leasing and finance; global corporate solutions; property, facility and project management; workplace solutions; appraisal, valuation and tax consulting; customized research; and thought leadership consulting. General Summary of Responsibilities Fully responsible for the day to day operation of the complex / building. Supervise and coordinate all maintenance and administrative staff assigned to the complex / building. Carry out all maintenance functions to the highest standard expected for the client and the subsidiary proprietors. Specific Job Requirements Effective management of the recreation facilities, common areas including car parks, landscape areas and all M&E plants, fixtures and fittings. Effective Maintenance Fund collection. Effective preventive maintenance programs to avoid large expensive repairs. Competitive tendering to ensure purchases and service contracts are on competitive terms. Completion of insurance claims for any damages to common property. Control expenses. Recommend a sound budget for each year to determine the amounts to be collected for the Maintenance Fund and Sinking Fund. Ensure compliance with warranties, guaranties and defect liabilities. Ensure high level of security, cleanliness and housekeeping. Covenant enforcement: Ensuring proper co-ordination/management of renovation works. Effective management of surplus funds through’ fixed deposits. Maintaining proper book-keeping and proper accounting records. Ensure GST returns are submitted on time. Ensure regular meetings are convened with the client and Pro-team Committee when it is formed and record and circulate all minutes of the meetings promptly. Ensure all insurance policies are renewed on time. Ensure all correspondence, statutory notifications and enquiries are promptly handled. Ensure effective control over all licensed contractors appointed to service the estate. Ensure that proper and fair booking system are done on the use of all the recreational facilities. Keep proper records of and attending all complaints, queries and suggestions made by the subsidiary proprietors/residents and to establish and maintain good relationship at all times. Lead a team of personnel of providing maintenance, finance, security, fire safety and car park management. Plan, implement, co-ordinate and control the various functions related to the above management aspects. Co-ordinate council meetings and general meetings. Prepare Minutes of Council Meetings. Ensure that members of the staff do not conduct himself or herself in a way which might bring the Management Corporation into disrepute. Ensure that no member of staff take personal advantage of privileged information obtained in the course of business. Ensure all contract works/ routine servicing are carried out accordingly as specified in their contracts agreement. Ensure that all orders and instructions issued by the Council either verbally or in writing are carried out promptly and efficiently. Ensure compliance with divisional policies Plan and carry out preventive building maintenance works for common facilities and properties. Ensure all residents’ complaints are attended to promptly and efficiently and monies collected are handed to the Accounts Department immediately. Place orders for building maintenance materials and to keep track of its issuance as and when required. In an emergency situation which occurs after office hours, ensure all concerned parties are contacted and recalled to attend and rectify/ reset the fault quickly. Plan duty roster, affecting replacement and covering of duties for all site staff. Day to day supervision of the site management staff. Oversee the security of the building and keep tenants informed of the emergency procedure. On site co-ordination of all plant and equipment maintenance by contractors. Maintenance of cleaning standards. Oversee the administration maintenance contracts. Ensure all purchase/ works orders issued are in order and within the budget allocated. Guide and supervise the property officer in the carrying out of all his duties. Prepare all tender documents, agreements, contracts and other legal documents. Review of property for insurance purpose and recommend sum insured for the various policies. Recommend annual salary adjustment. Review all contracts, agreements and insurance 2 months before their expiry and recommend renewal or call for quotation/ tender. Attend council Meetings and Annual General Meetings. Vet all outgoing correspondences and minutes of meetings. Involve in staff recruitment. Arrange for annual audit of accounts. Advise Council if expenditure is within the budget approved at General Meetings/Monthly financial accounts/revision monthly statement. Recommend appropriate actions to be taken against defaulters with assistance from solicitors. Any other duties assigned. Job Requirements: Degree in Building/Facilities Management or equivalent Minimum 3 years of experience in managing a building/facility Good knowledge of building maintenance Mature and independent with ability to lead a team Good interpersonal and communication skills Conversant in BMSM Act

As a global leader in mass spectrometry, SCIEX delivers solutions for precision detection and quantification of molecules to help protect and advance the wellness and safety of all. Because of our 50 years of groundbreaking innovation, our customers can quickly respond to environmental hazards, better understand biomarkers relevant to disease, improve patient care in the clinic, bring relevant drugs to market faster, and keep food healthier and safer. At SCIEX, you’ll find a rewarding role that amplifies your impact on the world and helps you realize life’s potential. SCIEX is proud to work alongside a community of nine fellow Danaher Life Sciences companies. Together, we’re pioneering the future of science and medicine, developing products that enable researchers in the fight to save lives. Purpose of this role: This role will provide YOU the opportunity to lead key activities to progress YOUR career, these responsibilities include some of the following: Providing scientific and technical support to internal customers and collaborators from Research and Product Development as needed. Identifying feasibility studies necessary to ensure critical analytical criteria of new products and products of value engineering are understood. Conducting studies, proposing iterative changes as necessary, to ensure that performance criteria can be met. Generating data and reports to support feasibility studies as required Designing multi-faceted validation plans that assess performance of new product development: their sub-systems and their integration Preparing validation protocols and reports presenting validation data and results to internal customers Ensure compliance of operations within area of concern with all relevant EHS regulatory requirement and SCIEX safety policies, procedures and guidelines Other duties/ ad hoc tasks as assigned. Why you? Basic Qualifications: We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals: Minimum Masters or Ph.D. in Analytical or Bio Analytical Chemistry or Biology preferred Minimum 5 years of experience in the Academia/Pharmaceutical/Biotech industry. Proficient in LCMS applications. Experience in quantitative and qualitative bioanalyses of small and large molecules is required. Candidates for this position must be independent and have strong troubleshooting capabilities. Preferred Qualifications: If you have the following experiences, it would be a plus: Experience with Applied Research in the field of Science/Chemistry/Engineering will be a bonus Knowledge of Statistics, Design of Experiments and Risk Analysis (i.e. FMEA, Cause and Effect etc.) will be advantageous. When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization. Danaher is committed to a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone feels they belong and all voices are heard. We believe in our associates and the unique perspectives they bring to every challenge, which is why we’ll empower you to push the boundaries of what’s possible. If you’ve ever wondered what’s within you, there’s no better time to find out. When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization. At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve.  Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes. If you’ve ever wondered what’s within you, there’s no better time to find out.

Job_Title: SENIOR ENGINEER, ASSET ENGINEERING (POWER & SERVICES – MECHANICAL)
Job_Descriptions: What the role is SENIOR ENGINEER, ASSET ENGINEERING (POWER & SERVICES – MECHANICAL) What you will be working on You will work closely with the Rail Operators to maintain good working knowledge of on-the-ground Operation & Maintenance (O&M) issues so as to facilitate return of the Rail Operators’ O&M experience to LTA’s design Divisions for continual improvement of the design of Singapore’s Rail Transit System’s (RTS) lines thereby contributing to continued/enhanced reliability/availability/safety of Singapore's RTS. You will work closely with Rail Operators to ensure that the RTS assets under your Division's charge are properly maintained by the Rail Operator to enable such assets to perform their functions reliably and safely. You will ensure that the operators optimise the costs and benefits (for life cycle management) of assets under the purview of the Division for the duration of the service life of such assets so that such information can be derived to inform decisions on asset refurbishment, renewal or life extension. You will review and audit the Rail Operator's maintenance plan/regime for compliance with the Rail Operator's submissions pursuant to NRFF licence condition. Your scope of works will include review of the design of tunnel ventilation system, air-conditioning and mechanical ventilation systems, fire protection systems, environmental control systems, plumbing/sanitary, pumped drainage, lifts and escalators. You will also provide engineering support in witnessing the testing, commissioning and handover of new assets to the Rail Operators. What we are looking for Requirements: Tertiary qualification in Mechanical Engineering At Least 6 years of experience in design / installation, operation and maintenance of tunnel ventilation systems, environmental control systems, fire protection systems, plumbing/sanitary, pumped drainage, lifts and escalators Conversant with all relevant technical standards and codes of practice Knowledge of railway work environment and relevant safety requirements Good leadership, communication and interpersonal skills Those with more years of relevant experience and professional credentials will be considered for senior positions

Job_Descriptions: What the role is EXECUTIVE ENGINEER/ ENGINEER, MAINTENANCE AUDIT PLANNER, ASSET ENGINEERING PLANNING & CONTROL What you will be working on You role is to oversee all maintenance audits and inspections conducted by the respective Asset Engineering Divisions. Job_Title: Manager (Data Analytics) / Senior Manager (Data Analytics)/ Assistant Director (
Job_Descriptions: What the role is As trustee of the nation’s retirement savings, the Central Provident Fund (CPF) Board helps 4 million CPF members save for their retirement, healthcare and housing needs. Every CPF Ambassador plays a vital role in helping Singaporeans save for a secure retirement. So long as you have the passion and commitment to serve the public, you will find your niche in our big family. What you will be working on  Conduct audits using computer-assisted audit tools such as ACL or programming language such as Python, R, etc.  Carry out data analytics tests to support Business Audits .  Work with other auditors and external stakeholders (Business and IT) to obtain understanding of processes and systems, to design data analytics tests to meet audit objectives.  Perform continuous auditing assignments using data analytics.  Perform any other duties as assigned. What we are looking for  Minimum of 4 years of relevant working experience in auditing.  Candidates must have scripting experience using computer-assisted audit tools, Python, R or other relevant programming languages.  Candidates must have good understanding of data structures and coding.  Able to work independently, a good team player and resourceful with good interpersonal and communication skills.  Candidates with experiences in using data science, AI, machine learning for audits would be greatly advantaged.

What the role is Infrastructure Asia (IA) is set up by Enterprise Singapore and Monetary Authority of Singapore. IA will work closely with the local and international partners across the infrastructure value chain, including infrastructure developers, institutional investors, multilateral & commercial banks, and technical, legal, accounting & financial services providers to provide solutions that are customised and good fit; to meet the specific project needs and requirements in Asian countries. We will also offer advice to relevant Asian countries and work with them on capacity building. As a focal point of knowledge, skills and resources, we can contribute to improving project feasibility and bankability, enabling more project leads to become viable commercial projects. What you will be working on Through in-depth interaction with local & international players and Asian governments, continuously update a pipeline of potential projects in the region; Match-make governments with infrastructure needs to Singapore-based firms; Organize Capacity Building & Connecting workshops together with our MOU partners (e.g. the World Bank Group, Singapore Business Federation) for focused countries & sub-segments; Advise regional governments in infrastructure project structuring (including alongside our MOU partners, like the World Bank Group); and, Assist IA senior team to prepare and participate in external events to build mindshare and thought leadership for Asian Infrastructure. What we are looking for Minimum of 1-2 years of work experience preferable, candidates without experience are welcome to apply (for Lead position) and at least 8-10 years of work experience (for Senior Lead position) in the infrastructure sector or in a relevant sub-segment, with a majority (or recent) focus on business development; Driven, enterprising, takes ownership in driving projects to achieve results; Excellent negotiation, persuasion and written-communication skills (any additional Asian language skills is a plus); Strong analytical skills; Willingness to travel frequently; Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment; and, Experience in financing or structuring solutions for infrastructure projects or companies is a plus.

Job_Title: SENIOR ENGINEER / EXECUTIVE ENGINEER, ASSET MANAGEMENT SYSTEM & PLANNING
Job_Descriptions: What the role is SENIOR ENGINEER / EXECUTIVE ENGINEER, ASSET MANAGEMENT SYSTEM & PLANNING What you will be working on You will be involved in the strategy, design and implementation of an Asset Management System and its supporting capabilities and processes for rail assets in LTA. You will review the Authority’s and Operators’ asset management system to meet ISO 55001 (Asset Management) requirements, to enhance and sustain good asset performance. You will also review and monitor Operators’ submission to comply with the Licence Asset Management Requirements and Maintenance Performance Standards. You will be involved in Life Cycle Cost (LCC) analysis for replacement of assets, typically conducting statistical analysis and prepare reports for submission to management. other administrative portfolios as assigned Play an active role in school and campus events, activities, and operations e.g., via taskforces, workgroups, meetings, and self-development programmes Support the school’s marketing activities including: (a) Designing creative strategies that drive programme demand   (b) Collaborating with internal teams and vendors to create digital content for multiplatform delivery including copywriting marketing collaterals   (c) Addressing queries arising from digital campaigns and communication (d) Report on the performance of digital marketing campaigns including evaluating end-to-end customer experience across multiple channels and customer touch points (e) Identifying trends and insights, and optimizing spend and performance, based on analysis and insights (f) Identifying critical conversion and drop off points and optimizing user funnel What we are looking for Relevant qualification preferably in Game Design/Development, Computer Science, Digital Interactive Media, User Experience A minimum of three years of relevant industry experience preferably in a creative sector A strong sense of initiative, and the ability to work both independently and as a team-player in collaborative settings The ability to manage projects and events whilst adhering to strict timelines, and conduct post implementation project reviews Excellent oral and written communication skills, including the ability to present to large and small groups, and a sensitivity to the needs of people of diverse academic, socio-economic, and cultural backgrounds A self-starter, agile learner, with a personal interest in coaching and mentoring others and managing stakeholder expectations Strong analytical, administrative and digitalisation skills including accessing databases and IT-enabled automation Additional Advantages: Teaching or professional training experience Management experience Experience using digital design applications (Adobe or similar) and E-learning tools (e.g., Adobe Captivate or similar) Experience creating augmented or virtual reality games (e.g., Augmented Reality application development) Design of Gamification experiences for learning or serious games We also encourage applications from persons with disabilities and will make any reasonable adjustment that is required both in the interview process and on the job.

Business operations in these countries report to Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd, located in Singapore. In short, Bosch creates technology that is “Invented for life.” We at Bosch.IO, the software and system company in the Bosch Group, design, develop and operate innovative software and system solutions globally. Our team delivers end-to-end solutions in Singapore using agile methodologies. You have taken part in multiple software development lifecycles from design to production You are able to drive the development of a software component independently You have experience how to apply modern methodologies like Continuous Delivery, Zero Downtime and principles like Software-as-a-Service Your mind is open for new technology and you are a quick learner You have a positive attitude, manage your own time and tasks, and feel comfortable in an established team of young developers You understand the value of automation for testing, monitoring and logging You have experience in modern technological stacks, frameworks and well-known cloud platforms such as Java, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, Spring Boot, AngularJS, Maven/Gradle, Azure Qualifications Degree in Computer Science Engineering or any related discipline Successfully designed the UX and UIs for software products or features including responsive apps for mobile devices Good analytical and problem solving skills, self-motivated and proactive approach Able to work independently on self-assigned tasks Possess very good communication skills (English) and a strong team player

Quantitative Risk Manager (Contract-convertible to permanent) Job Summary Singapore Contract BBBH799571 Nov 19, 2021 Competitive Job Description My client, a well reputed hedge fund is looking for a Quantitative Risk Manager to support the system migration. This is a part of the risk management group and is highly convertible to permanent. Quantitative Risk Manager (6 Months contract - convertible on the basis of performance) Morgan Mckinley is working in partnership with a globally leading hedge fund that is looking to fill a role in its Risk Management Group. The Risk Management Group is responsible for the measurement of the firm's risk exposures, the value at risk, betas, and multiple scenarios calculations, the setting up and monitoring of specific limits to safeguard the firm's loss appetite and the risk data integrity of the official reporting to clients and regulators. All this reference data is processed and distributed to the end users with an in-house infrastructure, operated by the Risk Infrastructure Group, reporting into CRO. Job Description The Quantitative Risk Manager will report to the CRO and will interface daily with the Risk Infrastructure Group. The role combines classic risk management functions together with challenging modelling and quantitative work and project responsibility. Lead all analytics projects: working with CRO to ensure all statistics and risk metrics used across the board are defined and implemented consistently and with a state-of-the-art approach. Work on the design of new metrics, signals when required. Design, implement, manage, and report a set of stress tests, historical and ad hoc scenarios. Operate and improve Beta model (model at the core of investment process) such as maintain and improve existing code base and liaise with PMs and CRO to agree improvements to the model Maintaining the existing risk limit code base to keep it operational always and consistent with its definitions. This includes providing production support with associated live IT processes/ analytics. Sign off on official regulatory and client risk reporting. Review all risk taking once a week and report detailed positioning to CRO. Express market views and prepare risk management challenges to Front Office. Help CRO preparing for weekly risk calls, monthly risk committee and monthly PM meetings The Successful Applicant As a successful applicant, you would have the following skills & qualifications: Ideal candidates will be risk managers with a quantitative background, 5-10 years' experience, with cross asset class market risk management knowledge as well as quantitative finance and database management knowledge, together with very good coding capabilities. Outstanding academic achievements with 5-10-year relevant professional experience Good practical knowledge in Java/Python/SQL/R is a must Good cross asset class products and market risk management processes knowledge Relevant experience in machine learning is a plus but not required Analytical, Problem Solving, creative thinking and design skills Clearly demonstrated sense of urgency, ability to work well under pressure and independently Referrals are greatly appreciated. Morgan McKinley Pte Ltd EA Licence No: 11C5502 Registration No: R1770166 Registration Name: Suhani Malhotra Only shortlisted candidates will be responded to, therefore if you do not receive a response within 14 days please accept this as a notification that you have not been shortlisted.

Job_Descriptions: Head of Integrated Marketing - CardsPal - SC Ventures About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. Ready to take the next step in your career with us? To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. CardsPal's solution is an innovative app leveraging on data, analytics to drive the business. This is a rare opportunity for a self-driven, strong entrepreneurial spirit, start-up minded, solid and passionate Head of Integrated Marketing to join and contribute to a venture. Able to thrive with cross-functional teams, be comfortable with ambiguity and change, and exhibit excellent critical thinking and digital marketing skills. Comfortable with data, able to extract insights and make good sense from data with experimenting mindset and able to conduct hypothesis, validate, improve and iterate effectively. Able to develop and foster teams that can deliver excellent results/ growth. Our Ideal Candidate Bachelor's Degree in digital marketing, marketing, data related discipline > 10 years of hands-on product and/or marketing experience Experience in building and leading a team with proven growth results Exceptional analytical skills - data driven approach to make recommendations for KPIs. Comfortable with data reporting and dashboards Experience in integrated marketing, in-app marketing and leading online campaigns Strong verbal and written communication skills. Excellent people and management skills with the ability to interact with all levels of staff, colleagues, cross-functional teams and third parties The ability to take ownership and see working at a start-up as a lifestyle Works collaboratively and with purpose Work effectively both independently and as part of a team must be a strong team player with ownership and focused on delivering results with high standards. Unafraid to be hands-on and provide leadership to grow and nurture junior team members. Always take the lead in starting up initiatives and would proactively set into motion things without others asking for it Always game to go above and beyond in delivering superlative results every day Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Has good product knowledge with strong technical background Possess strong interpersonal skills and maturity in handling clients' relationship Genuine commitment to generating and closing sales opportunities Strong sales personality, high energy level, resilient temperament, outgoing, resourceful and possesses intellectual curiosity Strong presentation and communication skills Motivated self-starter with strong work ethic Collaborative and collegiate team player Preferred Qualifications CFA preferred but not mandatory At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Company Description About Bosch Group The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services, employing roughly 400,500 associates worldwide and generating sales of 78 billion euros in 2017 (preliminary figures). Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology.  As a leading IoT company, Bosch offers innovative solutions for smart homes, smart cities, connected mobility, and connected manufacturing.  It uses its expertise in sensor technology, software, and services, as well as its own IoT cloud, to offer its customers connected, cross-domain solutions from a single source.  The Bosch Group’s strategic objective is to deliver innovations for a connected life.  Bosch improves quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm.  In short, Bosch creates technologies that is “Invented for life.” About Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd is a regional subsidiary of the Bosch Group, representing the Group’s interests in Southeast Asia, where it is currently present in all ASEAN member countries. The company is active in all the company’s four business sectors of Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. The Asia Pacific headquarters for its Automotive Aftermarket, Building Technology and Bosch Software Innovations businesses, as well as operations for Corporate Research and Advance Engineering, and Information Technology, are part of Robert Bosch (SEA) Pte Ltd. In Bosch, we are committed through our EVP ensuring all our associates to GROW , ENJOY and INSPIRE on their journey with us. Job Description In this role as a Assistant Logistics Manager for Building Technology business, you will be responsible for KPI performance and smooth operations of outsourced Continental Distribution Center-Singapore (CDC) and Shipping Operations. You will transport management in APAC region including Chin and will drive yearly budgets and forecast planning on CDC's Warehousing,  Shipping and Freight cost.  You will provide expertise advise and support to AP-CSO on warehousing and Transportation to meet the monthly sales target, handle customer Logistics Planning (CLP) function for portable Speaker portfolio. In addition, you will ensure digitalization of warehousing and Transportation; and   do the budget planning and cost owner for CSO warehousing and transport. You other responsibilities includes: Manage Outsourced CDC You will ensure that GS & 3PL is meeting the agreed KPI and smooth operation and the BU's requested services is deployed to CDC eg, VAS, Late conifiguration, CSO special instructions You will constantly work with GS & 3PL to Optimise warehouse process to achieve highest efficiency with lowest cost and to support RFQ run by GS, Migration Planning on Physical warehouse move & EWM system. You will also drive monthly Invoice Verfication on special services not covered by GS. EWM Specialist You will be the EWM Key User and perform regression testing 4 times a year. You will design warehouse layout, optimise processes, Digitalisation using EWM. Manage outsourced Shipping Operation You will ensure the Shipping Team operate within the agreed KPI target and smooth operation, design the job scope and workload distribution per each shipping agent and optimize shipping process to achieve highest efficiency with lowest cost. You will further develop forwarder matrix per lane base on optimum cost and service performance. Transport Management You will drive analysis of Transportation cost per BU, per CSO and mode of transport, assign corporate forwarder to specific country or lane base on optimum cost and service performance, handle logistics complaint and insurance claim relevant to transportation damages. Monthly sales activity support You will support RFQ and migration process, manage container allocation planning and pre-booking to support CSO delivery and drive adhoc support to MP or YBFR supplier for booking of container. You will raise bonarparte PO per forwarder per quarter; verify and approve forwarder’s invoices. Customer Logistics Planning You will drive demand planning on BU CO for Portable speaker's portfolio and to meet KPI target for DIO (Days of Inventory Onhand) & CSL2 (customer service level delivery performance). CDC Budget Planning You will budget plan and forecast planning on Physical Warehouse, Shipping, Broker and Transportation cost and drive measures to lower the cost. You will justify GS/OSD allocation on Shared Service, namely Physical Warehouse. Digitalization of Logistics & Project Study You wil l drive digitization of logistics platform and project study: eg. Center of gravity study for CDC AP (eg, cost comparison between CN and SG) & China Train Project eg. CIP project to improve efficiency and lower the operational cost Any other tasks as assigned by the Company Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a Bachelor degree in Logistics management or International supply chain management with at least 5 – 8 years of work leadership experience within the logistics function. You must be competent in SAP PC4, EWM, SAC, Excel BW reporting and candidate with prior experience in warehouse management, shipping function, order fulfillment, transportation, regional and project experience will be an added advantage. You should have knowledge in IncoTern 2020, FTA, IATA regulations, Up-to-date Logistics Concept and Tools and be a strategic thinker. You must be able to multi-task and be able to work in highly complex and fast pace environment. You must be result oriented and be equipped with strong leadership. You must be independent and resourceful and able to communicate at all levels.

Job Description In this role as a Country Team Coach for our Global Services, you will provide leadership to the team in Singapore and be responsible for the BSW (Business Serviced Warehousing), transport and broker service. You will supplier management with 3PLs to ensure good logistics services to internal customers for business support. You will manage daily operations to make sure good performance is delivered, drive lean maturity with warehouse LSP for continuous improvement in the operations and define 3PL strategy and lead tender projects as operations owner for warehousing and transport. You will drive productivity improvement, cost reduction efforts with all parties to maximize Bosch’s benefits. You will carry out legality study, cost analysis, etc. to support business units for their strategic projects, provide logistics know-how and consultancy to internal customers for any inquiries over logistics. You will budget plan and control for department & logistics cost, and internal charging. You will drive internal selling of logistics services to internal customers in SG for overall Bosch’s synergies. In addition, you will be responsible for internal/external audit, and compliance topics regarding logistics. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a Bachelor degree in Logistics or related fields with at least 5 – 8 years of work leadership experience within LSP management and tender project. You must have good business overview and know-how in foreign trade, warehousing, transport areas, and in lean logistics. You must have strong sense of work responsibility to drive for success with supervisor being remote and with certain ambiguity. You should have good communication and negotiation skills in front of both internal customers/suppliers and LSPs; You must be courageous to be reasonably challenging even in difficult situations and about to reach agreement in the end.

Job Description As part of our business expansion strategy, we are looking for a Junior Embedded Software Engineer to join our team in Singapore office. This Software Engineer will understudy from our senior engineer and learn how to gather user requirements, defining system functionality and writing code; design, develop and install within a system. You will also learn to manage the process of product development life cycle from preliminary system analysis to tests and deployment. You will be developed and be responsible for: Software programming definition (20%) How to conclusive study of the customer requirements, technical concept/solutions and test cases; manage schedule and timeline; and write codes and ensure development process is well stablished and followed by the team and keep development transparency with stakeholders You will learn and support architecture decisions for a robust and scalable product and define development plan based on the request and maintain on-time delivery. Software development life cycle (30%) You will learn to perform software coding implementation and ensuring good software efficiency, implement unit test code and Doxygen documentation; and perform code review session. Software Testing (20%) You will learn to perform unit test and integration test; develop test plans, specifications, cases and scripts. Technical support (30%) You will learn to provides technical specification for product manuals and brochure, support on-site field testing if necessary and also after sales Firmware supports. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a Bachelor Degree in Engineering or Computer Science major. You must have strong analytical and problem-solving skills; be self-motivated and proactive in your attitude. You must be open to learn and be quick to adapt into a fast pace project and timeline sensitive work platform. You must be agile and have strong team based mindset.

Job Description In this role as a Senior Web Developer for our Building Technology business, you will be responsible for the designing, coding and modifying websites, from layout to function and according to a system specifications. You will strive to create visually appealing sites that feature user-friendly design and clear navigation. You will also build easy-to-use, high-performance websites working with team and stakeholders, drive analysis of system specifications and requirements and participate in the full development lifecycle, including estimation, design, development, testing, and deployment. You will build high quality, scalable services through good software engineering principles and practices, plan and design framework for both near-term deliverable and long-term sustainability; support development of other developers through mentoring, code review, and knowledge sharing. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a Degree in Computer Science with at least 6 years of working experience in responsive web design & development. You must be an expert in web markup, including HTML5, CSS3 and Javascript with extensive experience of client-side scripting and React technology. You must have strong knowledge of design patterns to create simple and reusable components for complex UIs, possess technical knowledge in distributed real-time systems, process automation and object orientation. You must be structure & solution driven, with good analytical and problem solving skills. You must be self-motivated and equipped with good communication skills and be a strong team player.

Job Description Our Bosch Security Solutions, a leading brand in Singapore with extensive range of products portfolio in the domain of video surveillance, intrusion detection, fire detection, voice alarm,  public announcement systems, professional audio and conferencing system as well as access control and management systems. Through the years, our products are well received by our Singapore based customers has collaborated with us through our design, implementation and maintenance projects. As part of BOSCH’s business expansion strategy, our Security Solutions Business Unit is seeking for a technical competent System Engineer to join our team in Singapore office. In this role, you will provide support on system proposal consisted of hardware/software/IT components, solving of technical issues, perform Testing and Commissioning (T&C) on the ELV System (ACS, IDS, CCTV, PA, Intercom, Network, IT Security etc integrated Solution). You will also be responsible for: Project System Design Planning You will review and identify any non-conformity of awared project system proposal, sales offer & contract specification, perform value engineering on system solution to optimize cost & completion schedule. You will liaise with 3rd party System (internal/external) to align system implementation & integration back to main system and establish overall system design configuration for smooth implementation & delivery within schedule & budget. Project implementation You will support Project Team to align the site T&C activities for manpower deployment, survey site condition & readiness for T&C base on provided checklist from Project Team       and to provide System Write-up, Test Script & Migration Procedure etc to client & consultant. In addition, you will conduct System Demo/POC & FAT (Factory Acceptance Test) to client & consultant and support Project Team to attend technical meeting/discussion with client & consultant. Testing and Commissioning (T&C) You will perform T&C on field device/equipment base on provided checklist from Project Team, co-ordinate with internal / external stakeholder on any 3rd party integration & customization. You will setup, configure & commission the backend system to monitor & control online field devices,  conduct SAT (Site Acceptance Test) to client & consultant  and prepare training notes to conduct system operational training to end user. Reporting You will be responsible for the reporting System T&C status & progress with respect to milestone schedule and for the reporting of technical challenges hindering T&C progress that impact completion time frame. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a Bachelor / Diploma in the Electrical, IT, Computer Science or related study with least 3- 5 years of experience in system engineering in a similar position of relevant industry. You must have good presentation skill and knowledge in product/systems for security & ELV, have a pleasant personality and possess great leadership skill. You must be proactive, able to self-motivate and have self-independent attitude towards assigned tasks. You must be customer oriented and with entrepreneurial mindset. You must be result and future oriented. Candidate with knowledge on Electronic Security systems(Card Access, CCTV(Analog/IP), Intrusion, Fire&PAetc), Construction, ELV project relevant law, regulation and requirements will be an added advantage.

Job_Title: Intern, Product Marketing Automotive Aftermarket APAC
Job_Descriptions: Company Description The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services. 390,000 associates generated sales of 73 billion Euros in the areas of automotive and industrial technology, consumer goods, and building technology in fiscal 2016. The Bosch Group comprises Robert Bosch GmbH and its more than 440 subsidiaries and regional companies in some 60 countries. With all its products and services, Bosch enhances the quality of life by providing solutions which are both innovative and beneficial. Job Description We are offering an internship within the Product Marketing department of the Bosch Automotive Aftermarket Asia Pacific Division which is based in Singapore. Our focus is to formulate business and product strategies for more than 14 countries in Asia Pacific to continuously grow our automotive aftermarket business in the region. We are looking for enthusiastic and dynamic candidates to join us for internships of 6 months. Supporting and coordination of product marketing responsibilities with focus on: Defining programs to meet market specific requirements Developing communication concepts and material Conducting market research Project management Organizing meetings, workshops and events Marketing analysis and reporting Qualifications Student in Business, Communication or Marketing with interests in Automotive or Student in Mechanical, Automotive or Industrial Engineering Able to work full time for a period of 6 months starting mid-Jan 2022 Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Access and Power point Speak fluent English and work in a multinational environment Multi task and work independently Overseas travel may sometimes be required Additional Information Candidate should fulfil the visa requirements for employment in Singapore (as stated in www.mom.gov.sg) Applicant must be enrolled throughout internship period, or plan to pursue further studies For foreign students studying in Singapore on Student's Pass, you must fulfill the following requirements to be able to do full-time internship during the school term: You are a full-time matriculated or registered student in one of the approved institutions. You hold a Student Pass issued by the Immigration and Checkpoints Authority (ICA). The internship is under an industrial attachment programme conducted by your university or educational institution. The industrial attachment can be either compulsory or elective but it must contribute towards your graduation requirements. For more information: http://www.mom.gov.sg/passes-and-permits/work-pass-exemption-for-foreign-students

Company Description Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd is a regional subsidiary of the Bosch Group, representing the Group's interests in Southeast Asia where it is present in all ASEAN member countries. Business operations in these countries report to Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd, located in Singapore. Bosch has been present in Southeast Asia since 1919, with diversified businesses in the company's four business sectors - Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. Bosch's strategic objective is to improve quality of life with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm. In short, Bosch creates technology that is “ Invented for life. ” At Bosch, we care. For you, our business, and our environment. Let’s turn visions into reality. At Bosch,we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich people’s lives. Our areas of activity are every bit as diverse as our outstanding Bosch teams around the world. Their creativity is the key to innovation through connected living, mobility or industry. Our responsibility goes far beyond business. We’re independent of stock markets and bound to the purpose of the Robert Bosch Foundation; our success directly benefits society, the environment, and future generations. Our promise to our associates is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. Join in and feel the difference. Let’s be remarkable. Job Description As a Data Scientist the candidate will work on large-scale live HVAC testbeds to ensure smooth operation of tests, results collection, and analysis. The candidate will support the improvement of existing control strategies and assist in the development of new AI-based control algorithms. Specifically, the candidate will Operate on SQL databases to optimize data pipeline Generate test automation routines to run large scale tests Ensure smooth operation with error detection and data quality assessment Analyze results with statistical tools to provide insights for further test and algorithms improvement Qualifications Able to work full time for a period of 6 months (Jan – Jul 2022) Undergraduate studies in related field of Engineering or Science Proficient in SQL databases (e.g. MySQL) Excellent command of python data science libraries (Pandas, Numpy, Matplotlib) Good knowledge of statistical principles Experience with IoT hardware and sensors

Job_Title: Senior Software Test Engineer, Video Platform …
Job_Descriptions: See job description for details NCS is a leading information and communications technology (ICT) and communications engineering services provider across the Asia-Pacific region. We are headquartered in Singapore and a wholly owned subsidiary of the Singtel Group. We have in-depth domain knowledge and unique capabilities that create business value for customers. We offer a broad range of services, including consulting, systems development and integration, business process outsourcing, infrastructure management and solutions, and technology solutions. As a Senior Software Test Engineer, the broad area of your job responsibilities will cover the following: Reviewing product design documentation to ensure that requirements stated are correct, unambiguous, and verifiable Consult with product development to evaluate system interfaces, operational requirements, and performance requirements of overall system Define test methods and create test plans for new or updated software projects to determine if the software will perform accurately and reliably according to documented requirements as well as established standards under both normal and abnormal conditions Recommend design improvements or corrections to engineers throughout the development process Maintain effective communication with the project software engineers on project limitation, capability, performance requirement and hardware interface changes Execute test plans and create test reports to describe program evaluation, testing, and correction Monitor program performance after implementation to prevent reoccurrence of program operating problems and ensure efficiency of operation Formulate and design software systems, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design Create test tools that facilitate data gathering and test method execution The Ideal candidate should possess the following: Bachelor's Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or equivalent technical Degree; or equivalent combination of education and experience Minimum 3 years working experience in software testing industry Familiar with at least one programming language, like Java, Python... Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools and processes Hands-on experience with both white box and black box testing Solid knowledge of SQL and scripting

Specialist, Product Sales About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Strategy Sales Activity & Conversion To work with Relationship Managers in achieving the target number of referrals and conversion. To train the Relationship Managers via regular training, workshops and case-studies in order to deliver on product knowledge, insurance proposition/pitch, processes and sharing of new ideas. To generate ideas and action plan on increasing sales activity and other relevant financial drivers. Business Customer Management To conduct fact find, insurance need analysis for clients and ensure prompt advise and solutions are offered to clients. To ensure a systematic review process for existing policyholders. To ensure that customer enquiries are promptly attended to. Processes Sales Reporting & Management To provide prompt and regular reporting of leads, sales activity and pipeline cases. Work closely with internal partners (e.g. Relationship Managers, fiduciary, and credit teams) and external partners (e.g. insurance providers) on case management. People and Talent Lead through example and build the appropriate culture and values. Set appropriate tone and expectations from their team and work in collaboration with risk and control partners Governance Compliance To comply with all applicable money laundering prevention procedures and in particular, report any suspicious activity to the Transaction Monitoring Unit. To ensure compliance with all regulations and controls as set by the Bank and external regulatory authorities. To adhere strictly to the FAA & good practices guideline, include attending weekly/monthly coaching, meeting & obtaining the required CPD hours. Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct and live by the Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct, across Standard Chartered Bank. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct. Lead to achieve the outcomes set out in the Bank's Conduct Principles : Fair Outcomes for Clients; Effective Financial Markets; Financial Crime Compliance; The Right Environment. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Key Stakeholders Priority International Clients Relationship Managers & Team Managers, Credit team, Insurance Providers. Our Ideal Candidate 5 plus years of relevant sales experience. M5, M5A, M8, M8A, M9, M9A HI, (BCP, Comm GI & PGI essential for Commercial and Business Banking IS). Excellent people management skills with strong interpersonal and communication ability to deal with people of all levels in complex and challenging situations. Self-motivator who is keen to upgrade, improve personal knowledge and skills to meet job requirements. Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Job_Title: VP, Change Management Lead, Service Channels &  …
Job_Descriptions: VP, Change Management Lead, Service Channels & Transformation, Global Consumer Financial Services ABOUT OCBC BANK OCBC Bank is the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world's most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody's. We have more than 540 branches and representative offices in 19 countries and regions with more than 29,000 employees globally. Our key markets are Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia and Greater China. We are also one of the largest listed banks in Southeast Asia by market capitalisation (listed on the SGX-ST). Together as a group with our subsidiaries, we offer a broad array of commercial banking, specialist financial and wealth management services, ranging from consumer, corporate, investment, private and transaction banking to treasury, insurance, asset management and stockbroking services. Further details can be found on our website www.ocbc.com ABOUT Group ConsUMER FINANCIAL SERVICES (GCFS) Global Consumer Financial Services covers wealth management, lifestyle financing, branch & premier banking, consumer secured lending, online banking, business transformation and marketing. We serve three million customers across Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia and China. In Singapore, we help people of all ages meet their financial life goals and lifestyle desires with products like Mighty Savers for children and young families, FRANK by OCBC for youth and young adults to OCBC Premier Banking for affluent customers. The business has pioneered many customer-centric banking products and services, including FRANK by OCBC, full-service Sunday Banking and our award-winning Online Banking. Leveraging digital transformation and solutions, we provide seamless omni-channel customer experience. We are also the market leader for bancassurance sales ROLE & responsibilities Advise business units by bringing a strategic point of view and sound approach to problem solving Plan and lead large-scale projects. Synergize business needs and customer requirements at a detailed level, ensuring alignment to strategic business objectives Champion efforts to design smooth, friction-less customer journeys Be well informed on market trends and forces. Synthesize insights from industry best practices, voice of customers, and business/support units to improve customer experience Coach junior team members throughout their project assignments and help with their professional development Qualifications DESIRED PROFILE At present, we are looking for individuals with customer and/or transformation experience to complement our existing team. The candidate should offer good financial services knowledge with sound knowledge of Human Centred Design and process improvement techniques. The candidate must have at least 5 years of experience with a reputable firm, global consulting company and/or customer experience/transformation division of leading financial institutions In an ideal candidate, we look for: Proven experience in delivering customer experience and/or transformation projects, preferably involving new business models Ability to learn quickly, think strategically and critically, and articulate complex ideas in understandable ways Good knowledge of how financial services businesses work and latest trends impacting the industry Comfortable working in an unstructured, cross-divisional and multi-stakeholder environment *LI-EN

Job Description To sustain the fast and qualitative development progress in Bosch, we are seeking for a passionate and driven Lead Linux OS Developer to join our IT team in Singapore. As a Linux Developer, you are require to develop and lead solutions together with the team. This position consists of 80% on project development and 20% on liaising with internal stakeholders. The selected candidate will liaise with the Linux community and internal clients (E.g: Developer community, XE Developer, EByte Site) within Bosch. You will be involved in developing, troubleshooting, and ensuring software projects requirements are met. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a Bachelor Degree in Information Science or Computer Science with at least 5 years of experience in Linux OS related functions. Candidate with strong Linux knowledge (E.g: Ubuntu, RHEL, CentOS), high level scripting language (E.g: Python, Ruby, Bash) and networking competency will be consider. Good understanding of Debian packaging knowledge, integration and Agile methodology will be an advantage for this position.

Job Description In this newly created role, we are inviting for a technical competent Data Engineer in the Cloud Analytics Solutions & Metadata Visualization (CAS) team of Robert Bosch Security Solutions Division. In this role, you will be architecting, designing, and building next-generation data products to galvanize digitalization in many sectors. We are looking for enthusiastic and passionate engineers to join us in this journey to make a difference.  You will be based in our research & development facility in Singapore. Your key responsibilities: You will design and build resilient and efficient data pipelines for both batch and real-time streaming data, architecting and scaling data analytics infrastructure on premises and on cloud environment; You will find opportunities to improve and optimize the workloads, processes to ensure that performance levels can support continuous accurate, reliable, and timely delivery of data products. You will collaborate with product manager, UX/UI designer, and work together with Full Stack senior software engineers to implement, build scalable and data-driven products. You will also be involved in the development of systems, architectures, and platforms that can scale large volume and variety, manage the continuous testing and development of data pipeline, new data sources and analytic dashboards. You will execute projects with an Agile mindset and candidate with backend modern C++ v11/14 software development for both Windows and Linux platform. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you should have degree or Masters in Computer Science, Computer or Electronics Engineering, Information Technology or related disciplines with at least 3 years of relevant experience in data engineering. You should have min. 3 years of working experience in modern C++ v11/14 development for both Windows and Linux and experience in  data streaming development and frameworks such as Apache Kafka, Spark, Flink, KSQL. You must also have experience with the cloud (e.g. AWS, Azure), writing efficient SQL and possess in-depth knowledge of SQL and NoSQL databases, including performance tuning and troubleshooting. You must have good experience in Python, Powershell, Shell scripting, multithreaded and socket programming; and also setting up of VM, servers and equipment for test. You must have Unified Modeling Language (UML) diagrams experience, be familiar with DevOps CICD tools such as Git, Docker, Kubernetes, be well versed in design principles, patterns, and micro-services and data streaming architecture. You must have competent technology knowledge in distributed real-time systems, process automation and object orientation and familiar with test-first approach affine and high-quality standard. You must be familiar with Web Service Protocols, such as SOAP and REST is a plus. Candidate with video domain knowledge is a plus. You must have ability to deliver on timelines and move quickly with multi-functional teams to execute on decisions while maintaining attention to details, possess good analytical and problem-solving skills, be self-motivated and execute with proactive approach. Candidate who has experiences with the Microsoft Test Manager, Microsoft Release Management and/or IT Security knowledge will be added advantage to this position. You must have very well-structured working style, be objective driven, strong in process, and quality orientation. Lastly, you should have good communication skills (verbal and written), be cooperative, have an open minded and be a strong team player.

Compliance Specialist - Client Review (1 Year Contract) At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group’s global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today! Overall Function The successful candidate is expected to be organized and numerate with excellent attention to detail, and to be able to work well within a team and yet take initiative and ownership over his/her own area of work. Roles & Responsibilities Conduct AML assessment on periodic reviews of existing relationships with financial intermediaries (e.g., Independent Asset Managers, Referral Intermediaries and FI Counterparties). Conduct investigations on suspicions surfaced during periodic review and prepare STR reports to the STRO Escalate issues identified in the periodic review process and providing practical solutions to business Monitor the Team's mailbox to ensure enquiries from Front Office are promptly handled or escalated Advise Front Office on requirements pertaining to KYC documentation for existing financial intermediaries (for e.g., change in ownership or account structure, refreshed ID documents etc.) Review and approve changes to the financial intermediary's KYC information in system. Collate and prepare statistics for periodic status updates to Front Office and Senior Management Liaise with Relationship Managers or Business Compliance Managers on issues pertaining to outstanding cases Participate in user acceptance testing for KYC system enhancement and implementation Other administrative duties as assigned by the Supervisors or Team Head Qualifications Requirements Minimum 2 years of experience in similar function. Private banking exposure is preferred but not a must. Strong attention to detail and controls, and can grasp new ideas and concepts quickly Ability to work under pressure, and manage workload and deadlines effectively Sound interpersonal skills and relationship building abilities Effective verbal and written communication skills Competent in Microsoft Office tools, particularly Excel University degree in Accountancy, Finance, Business Administration or equivalent, or higher education

Job_Title: Executive, Divisional Support, People Services (12 months contract) - (210001ZB)
Job_Descriptions: You will be part of the Divisional Support team within People Services to deliver customer-centric experience to various stakeholders. You will be responsible for executing HR operational processes from pre-onboarding to exit. Job Responsibilities You will provide professional support and ensure prompt and smooth execution of the employee life cycle activities, adhering to the local regulations and OCBC Group’s policies. Manage onboarding administration process including employee screenings, issuance of offer letters, employee declaration etc. Initiate post-employment screenings and highlight discrepancies flagged out in screening reports to the respective HR Business Partners Manage other staff movement activities such as transfers, secondment, conversions of employment types, retirement and cessation of employment Manage activities related to the Representative Notification Framework for financial advisers where required Administer work pass applications and renewals for employees and/or dependents Uphold good data management practices by ensuring accurate and up-to-date employee records in our HR systems Ensure timely storage of employee documents in our electronic personnel file system Provide thoughtful, accurate and timely responses to employees and stakeholders Any other duties or projects assigned Requirement Degree qualification in Human Resources or related discipline At least two years of relevant experience within the financial services industry is preferred Good knowledge of the Employment Act High level of initiative, meticulous and detailed oriented with strong organisation skills Ability to handle confidential information professionally and appropriately Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to work collaboratively with stakeholders Positive working attitude, results oriented and have a process and service-focused mind-set Energised by a fast-paced work environment, with the ability to multi-task and manage high volume work, with minimum supervision Willingness to embrace new HR technologies and changing processes

Job Description As part of our expansion plan in ASEAN, we are looking for a dynamic and hands-on External Affairs & Government Relations Specialist to be based in Singapore. In this role, you will develop advocacy strategies and action plans in alignment with the leadership team for the region. You will focus on trade policy & economic integration, road safety, electrification; prepare and coordinate political visits in Germany and Southeast Asia. You will represent Bosch’s interests externally in associations and on key events, monitor political environment with focus on relevant trends that affect Bosch’s business operations. You will establish, maintain, and manage networks with relevant internal and external stakeholders; support the development of efficient government relations structures and processes across the region. You must be pro-active and able to work effectively with teams across organizational and functional boundaries. You must have the ability to engage with complex stakeholders with different cultural and occupational background and with proven track record of successful project management beneficial.

Job Description We are looking for a dynamic Information Security Analyst to join our DSO team in Singapore. In this role, you are required to support the regional data security officer in the implementation of information security management system (ISMS) and data protection management system in the ASEAN region. You will assist business units to ensure compliance with all national, regional, information security and privacy regulations. You will examine regulations, contracts, agreements, and provides consultation from an information security & data protection perspective. You will conduct regular trainings for regional information security & data protection professionals. You will perform regular audits for topics including information security, data protection, and selected information. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a Bachelor Degree with at least 3 years of experience in the same function. You must have good understanding of the IT technology, ISO27001 framework; and with experienced in implementing information security management systems (ISMS). You must have strong understanding of the data protection regulations in ASEAN and in the GDPR. Candidate competent in CISA, CISSP, IAPP, etc will be value adding to this role. You must be able to work under pressure and with ability to manage sensitive and confidential information. You must also have excellent interpersonal and communication skills with strong attention to details.

Job Description As part of BOSCH’s business expansion strategy, our Research Centre is seeking for a well experience AIoT Research Scientist (Sustainability) to join our team in Singapore office. In this role, you will drive local innovation to support the vision of Urban Solutions and Sustainability in Corporate Research Singapore, also in alignment with Bosch Global strategy in AIoT domain. You will evaluate the ecosystem in Singapore / ASEAN, co-create with business units in relation to sustainability initiatives, contribute to long-term product portfolio of Bosch, perform customer interviews, and formulate problem statements and generate research proposal. You will drive hands-on work AIoT Applications, sensor networks, communication protocols, data analytics, machine learning, laboratory activities, design of experiment for proof of concept and create prototypes. You will identify “Best-In-Class” within local institutions and universities for potential collaboration. In additional, you will conduct regular alignment with Strategic Portfolio Owner, quarterly review project update, stakeholder management, idea pitching via Bosch Innovation Framework. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a PhD or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Environmental Service or similar. Candidate with thesis or relevant experience related to Digital Sustainability, Circular Economy or Waste Management will be highly appreciated. You should have minimum 3 years’ experience in performing at least 2 full-cycle AIoT research projects until prototypes, ideally with commercialization strategy, experience in applied IoT applications, data analytics. You should have high awareness of the latest technology trend with able to translate research effort into functional prototype, demonstrate to customers. You should have sound knowledge in sensor technology, system design and its application and has a passion for innovation, possessing entrepreneurial spirit and with excellent writing and communication skills. You should be able to work independently and in a team. You must have good working attitude and be able to adapt in a dynamic environment.

Job Description Be part of Bosch’s Digital Future and be in our very own Management Trainee ! This exclusive Bosch program which aims to develop highly qualified young professionals to assume management responsibility, preparing them for corporate success. During this 18 - 24 months program you will engage in diverse training opportunities; and be enrolled in an established mentoring system with our experienced top leaders. As a Management Trainee , you can look forward to being part of Bosch’s entrepreneurial spirit. Your role will be critical to shaping Bosch’s digital transformation journey. You will be part of the steering team involved in our new business strategies, be immersed in our Leadership Culture and experience first-hand working directly with top management. This is an excellent opportunity to showcase your creativity and innovation by strategizing new projects to position Bosch further up the market. This is a tailored career journey just for you! Your career path will be paved by your interests and motivations as you progress through the program. In addition, you will also gain international exposure to regional teams as well as an overseas rotation. Qualifications In this role, we are looking for candidates with minimally a Bachelor’s degree from a reputable University and up to 5 years professional experience. We are looking for talents who are resilient and determined. You must be curious and inquisitive; and be passionate about learning and development. You must have great leadership competency with successful track records of achievements. Candidate with strong background in a digital/technology domain will be an added advantage. Do you tick these boxes? Hit ‘Apply” button now to be a part of the Bosch family!

Job_Title: Product Manager for Electric Drives, Thermal Management and Steering Systems
Job_Descriptions: Company Description About Bosch Group The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services, employing roughly 400,500 associates worldwide and generating sales of 78 billion euros in 2017 (preliminary figures). Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology.  As a leading IoT company, Bosch offers innovative solutions for smart homes, smart cities, connected mobility, and connected manufacturing.  It uses its expertise in sensor technology, software, and services, as well as its own IoT cloud, to offer its customers connected, cross-domain solutions from a single source.  The Bosch Group’s strategic objective is to deliver innovations for a connected life.  Bosch improves quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm.  In short, Bosch creates technologies that is “Invented for life.” About Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd is a regional subsidiary of the Bosch Group, representing the Group’s interests in Southeast Asia, where it is currently present in all ASEAN member countries. The Asia Pacific headquarters for its Automotive Aftermarket, Building Technology and Bosch Software Innovations businesses, as well as operations for Corporate Research and Advance Engineering, and Information Technology, are part of Robert Bosch (SEA) Pte Ltd. In Bosch, we are committed through our EVP ensuring all our associates to GROW , ENJOY and INSPIRE on their journey with us. Job Description As part of BOSCH’s business expansion strategy, our Automotive Aftermarket Business Unit is seeking for a dynamic and competent Product Manager for Electric Drives, Thermal Management and Steering Systems to join our team in Singapore office. In this role, you will be responsible for the active management of the product portfolio, the definition of supply sources and the positioning of the product in the area. You will be responsible for the management of Product LifeCycle of their respective product lines.  This includes phase in and master data maintenance, change management (i.e. super sessions, plant transfers) and phase out.  During the products life, you will gather market requirements and feedback from the sales regions and supporting sales with product information and product training. Based on market and competitor observations, you will then derive the product strategy to ensure P&L business plan targets are achieved in their product area. You will manage product release, product cancellation, support selection of suppliers, calculation of planned sales quantities, pre-steering and target costing of procurement prices, definition of price points and lower price limits for sales. You will also lead BU product related growth projects in the APS region and define part numbers as per range and brand Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a Bachelor Degree in Engineering with focus on Marketing and with at least 3- 5 years of experience in marketing function. You must have good interpersonal and communications skills and be confident in doing sales pitch. You must have great presentation skills with strong experience in key systems like BW, SAP or FAS. You should have adequate knowledge on how our products fulfill in the vehicle, ability to differentiate their features and benefits on both commercial and technical side to present them to the relevant stakeholders. You be competent of the 5P's principle, market leverages, product costing/pricing and other product related commercial/financial processes. You should be entrepreneurial and with strong personal initiatives. You will improve business processes, drives partnerships with all members of the AA business. You will communicate proactively and effectively at all levels and be a dynamic team player.
