Job Description About the role As part of BOSCH’s business expansion strategy, our Automotive Aftermarket Business Unit is seeking for a dynamic and competent Data Engineer to join our team in Singapore office. In this role, you will work in the regional logistics innovation team that is responsible for the design of the Automotive Aftermarket supply chain and logistics processes in Asia Pacific. You will contribution to reach our target of end-to-end transparency, the digitalization of our supply chain and supporting our operational logistics team in planning and operations with flexible data analytics. You will create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture, assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. You will identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc. You will build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources. You will build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency, and other key business performance metrics. You will work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs. You will create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader. You will work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems. You will provide technical input on design, development and implementation for major solutions. You must be able to work independently (e.g. individual contributor) as well as in a team (e.g. group contributor). You must have a passion for technology, good communicator, team player, positive and can-do attitude. Qualifications Requirements To be successful in this role, you must have a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems and or another quantitative field with at least 3 years of experience in demand / supply planning function.  You must have advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of database. You must be experienced building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets, experienced performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement. You should have strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets, to be able to build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management. You must have successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets, be skilled in project management and organizational. You must have experience in supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment. You must have good understanding of SAP R/3 incl. data structure. You must have basic knowledge of industrial business processes, knowledge in logistics and supply chain; in Web Portal and mobile development is plus.

Job_Title: Director / Associate Director, Impact Investing, UOB Venture Management
Job_Descriptions: About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department UOB Venture Management Private Limited (UOBVM) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB). Since 1992, UOBVM has been providing direct equity investment to privately-held companies in Southeast Asia and Greater China. We advocate responsible investing through impact investments and integrating Environmental, Social and Governance considerations into our investment process. UOBVM is a signatory of the Operating Principles for Impact Management and the United Nations-supported Principles for Responsible Investment. Our assets under management is in excess of S$2 billion. Job Responsibilities UOBVM is the fund manager for the Asia Impact Investment Fund series and we have an opening for an experienced and self-driven professional to join us in our Singapore office, in the investment team for impact investments. As a member of the impact investing team, you will be responsible for all aspects of making impact investments. These include sourcing and evaluating investment deals, negotiation, deal structuring, due diligence, portfolio monitoring, value creation as well as preparing the portfolio companies for liquidity events. The candidate will also be expected to be involved in ESG activities, impact assessment and liaison with internal and external stakeholders in the impact and sustainability space. A key part of the job is to establish good network and contacts within the region to achieve our investment and impact objectives.  Travel on a regular basis within the region is expected. Job Requirements A good degree from a recognized university. Those with a postgraduate qualification such as MBA, CPA or CFA would have an advantage At least 8-10 years’ relevant experience either in private equity/venture capital investments or investment banking or financial advisory Preferably with ESG investing or impact investment experience or strong impact investing interest Experience in healthcare, education, financial inclusion or agriculture would be an advantage Good business development and analysis skills with an understanding of the ASEAN market, strong network of business contacts and ability to source deals within the region Strong communication, writing and interpersonal skills Able to work independently and as part of a team Proficiency in reading and writing Chinese to handle Chinese speaking markets (in order to understand and handle documents written in Chinese language) Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Job_Title: Demand Planning Analyst and Key User
Job_Descriptions: Company Description About Bosch Group The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services, employing roughly 400,500 associates worldwide and generating sales of 78 billion euros in 2017 (preliminary figures). Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology.  As a leading IoT company, Bosch offers innovative solutions for smart homes, smart cities, connected mobility, and connected manufacturing.  It uses its expertise in sensor technology, software, and services, as well as its own IoT cloud, to offer its customers connected, cross-domain solutions from a single source.  The Bosch Group’s strategic objective is to deliver innovations for a connected life.  Bosch improves quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm.  In short, Bosch creates technologies that is “Invented for life.” About Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd is a regional subsidiary of the Bosch Group, representing the Group’s interests in Southeast Asia, where it is currently present in all ASEAN member countries. The company is active in all the company’s four business sectors of Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. The Asia Pacific headquarters for its Automotive Aftermarket, Building Technology and Bosch Software Innovations businesses, as well as operations for Corporate Research and Advance Engineering, and Information Technology, are part of Robert Bosch (SEA) Pte Ltd. In Bosch, we are committed through our EVP ensuring all our associates to GROW , ENJOY and INSPIRE on their journey with us. Job Description About the role As part of BOSCH’s business expansion strategy, our Automotive Aftermarket Business Unit is seeking for a dynamic and competent Demand Planning and Key-User to join our team in Singapore office. You will be responsible for the following: Demand Planning You will create and maintain an accurate demand plan based on statistical and customer input. You will drive the Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process within the Go-to-Market stakeholders. You will manage inventory within the scope of responsibilities, including at the Local Distribution Centre (LDC) and Goods In Transit (GIT). You will identify improvement potential in the area of demand planning and collaborate with APS stakeholders for effective implementation. You will provide operational support as required, and perform as proxy to the Demand Planning role within the team. Business Analytics & Key-User You will identify improvement potentials in the area of demand planning, support the AA-APS business and drive data analytics in the team and adaption of new tools. You will create transparency and liaise with AA/LOI-AP team to design and roll-out projects which support the Go-to-Market requirements. You will recommend and execute various supply chain activities within the region and working with global stakeholders. Specific Tasks / Requirements You should be in hands-on position involving detail data farming and extensive analytic activities in tandem with management reporting responsibilities.  You will identify processes and support analysis by providing statistical information to improve service, operating efficiencies and costs. You will be engaged in multiple business wide projects to ensure the processes are delivered within the agreed business tolerances. Qualifications Requirements To be successful in this role, you must have a Master / Bachelor Degree in Supply Chain, Business Administration or related fields with at least 5 - 7 years of experience in demand / supply planning function or minimum 5 years of commercial analytical experience in sales performance and inventory control. Candidate with experience in planning and procurement in Automotive Aftermarket will be a plus. You should be skilled in project management, and familiar with statistical concepts, be strong in analytics, reporting and presentation. You should be competent in standard ERP software SAP, Microsoft (especially MS applications, PowerBI) and forecasting system. You should be analytical and process oriented, possess strong problem-solving skills and be able to work in a team and have good understanding of cultural diversity

Company Description About Bosch Group The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services, employing roughly 400,500 associates worldwide and generating sales of 78 billion euros in 2017 (preliminary figures). Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology.  As a leading IoT company, Bosch offers innovative solutions for smart homes, smart cities, connected mobility, and connected manufacturing.  It uses its expertise in sensor technology, software, and services, as well as its own IoT cloud, to offer its customers connected, cross-domain solutions from a single source.  The Bosch Group’s strategic objective is to deliver innovations for a connected life.  Bosch improves quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm.  In short, Bosch creates technologies that is “Invented for life.” About Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd is a regional subsidiary of the Bosch Group, representing the Group’s interests in Southeast Asia, where it is currently present in all ASEAN member countries. The Asia Pacific headquarters for its Automotive Aftermarket, Building Technology and Bosch Software Innovations businesses, as well as operations for Corporate Research and Advance Engineering, and Information Technology, are part of Robert Bosch (SEA) Pte Ltd. In Bosch, we are committed through our EVP ensuring all our associates to GROW , ENJOY and INSPIRE on their journey with us. Job Description In this role as a Key Account Manager for our Building Technology business, you will manage, develop and expand the relationships with the assigned strategic accounts. You be hold sales quota for the assigned strategic accounts to meet business objectives for national and/or global partners of Bosch Security Systems. You will fully engage in the sales process, selling to the higher level National and/or Global Account Managers, Sales Representatives or Account Executives within the assigned account’s organization. You will promote the entire range of Bosch Security products, while leading the account planning process, ensuring that customer needs and expectations are clearly defined and met. You will support customers across the local Region, and therefore requires extensive travel. You will establish productive, professional relationships with corporate and field personnel for assigned accounts. You will meet assigned targets for sales volume and strategic objectives and identify and communicate the involvement of necessary Bosch resources to achieve account objectives and meet customer expectations, including: Bosch management, sales (direct and manufacturer’s representatives), business development, technical support, customer service. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a Bachelor’s Degree in technical or related field with at least 7 years in technical Sales and working with SMT levels within an organization in the Security solutions industry. You must be entrepreneurial and be innovative with ability to conceptualize and implement strategic market/product planning. You should have excellent technical and interpersonal skill with good follow-up and integrative abilities. You should be a strong team player but still be able to work independently when needed. You must be resourceful and self-confident to drive the product business. Candidate with strong p roficiency in CRM applications and MS office skills will be an added advantage. Due to the requirements of the role which requires you to manage key accounts across the region, you must be able to travel 80% for your role.

Job Description In AquaEasy (A Bosch Company), we transform aquaculture from art to science by connecting directly the farmers with the best aquaculture experts. Supported by a unique combination of sensors, artificial intelligence and automation, AquaEasy helps the farmers to make daily decisions, reduce risks and increase shrimp yields. Our Solutions and services include Health Management of Shrimps, Cost Management, Water Quality Management & Farm Management. As part of our business expansion, we are seeking one position of UX Designer for our Singapore office. In this role, you will work as part of a cross functional team developing a market leading IoT solution for aquaculture. You will collaborate with product manager, engineers, and cross-functional stakeholders to understand requirements, and provide creative, thoughtful solutions. You will translate requirements into flow diagrams, mockups and high-fidelity prototypes, take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs. You will design, illustrate and produce graphic assets, optimize UX for a wide range of devices and interfaces (Web & Android). Candidate who is able to work with high level of autonomy will be critical to the success of this role. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a Bachelor’s Degree in Design, User Experience, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience. You should have at least 3 years of experience in UX design and UI development. You should have online portfolio showing experience in designing web and mobile applications, be proficient with standard design tools- Photoshop, Illustrator, XD and Figma and be hands-on with HTML, S/CSS, Material design guidelines. Passionate UX designer who is excited about taking early stage products from concept to execution will be ideal for this role.

Job Description As part of BOSCH’s business expansion strategy, our Automotive Aftermarket Business Unit is seeking for a dynamic and competent Inventory Specialist – Japanese Speaking to join our team in Singapore office. In this role, you will be accountable for: Demand Planning You will create and maintain the demand plan based on statistical and customer input. You will drive the Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process within the Go-to-Market stakeholders. You will manage inventory within scope of responsibilities, including at the Local Distribution Centre (LDC) and Goods In Transit (GIT). You will identify improvement potential on demand planning and collaborate with APS stakeholders for effective implementation. You will provide operational support as required; and perform as proxy to the Demand Planning role within the team. Business Analytics You will identify improvement potentials on demand planning, support the AA-APS business and drive data analytics in the team and adaption of new tools. You will create transparency and liaise with AA/LOI-AP team to design, create and roll-out PowerBI dashboards which support the demand planning team and creates transparency for planners and management. You will analyse, recommend and execute various supply chain activities within the region, and working with global stakeholders. Candidates with commercial analytical experience in sales performance and inventory control will be highly desirable. You must be competent in analytics, reporting and presenting skills. You should be analytical and be process oriented, possess strong problem solving skills and with team oriented working behavior. You must have good understanding of cultural diversities and comfortable in managing relationships. Java Software Engineer - Analyst - Securities Trade Processing MORE ABOUT THIS JOB What we do At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don't just make things - we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets. Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical centre of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here. The Opportunity We own, evolve and support the technology platforms that handle the post-execution processing for the Securities Execution, Prime Clearing, and Prime Brokerage businesses. This includes exchange and broker trade processing, internal firm/firm trades and client delivery across physical and synthetic products. We are at the start of a multi-year convergence program to deliver all of these businesses onto a single, high scalable platform, enabling business growth with reduced operational costs. We're looking for highly technical, commercially minded, software engineers who enjoy seeing things done differently to join us on this exciting journey. About the team Our team consists of 17 people in Singapore and around 70 globally. Almost all of our projects are cross-location and cross-function, meaning we work directly with Front Office, Operations, Legal, Tax, and our Engineering colleagues from those areas, across the wider firm. We work directly with Operations and Securities sales/trading, to design and implement, a wide range of functions including trade aggregators, trade matchers, payment systems, intercompany trade booking and settlement systems, and connectivity to exchanges, counterparties and vendors. Our Exception Workflow and Business Intelligence tooling allows our Operations teams to respond to client enquiries and monitor service levels. Our Post Execution platform consists of a variety of applications that demand high throughput, performance and availability, including our strategic new Post Execution Sequencer platform which is a brand new/greenfield initiative to converge all of our businesses onto a single technology platform, to proving much better scalability, improved resiliency and reducing the time needed to develop and deliver new features. Highly-developed analytical and technical skills, combined with a commercial and collaborative approach to problem solving, are essential to our success. Responsibilities Design, build and maintain a high-performance, high-availability, high-capacity, yet nimble and adaptive platform for transaction cost analytics and execution research Develop highly reliable data ingestion processes to consume large volumes of data emitted by trading and market data systems. Design distributed computation infrastructure and libraries to run parallelized queries over large volumes of data. Design, build and maintain applications to monitor performance of trading strategies in relation to the market in real time. Use data to guide decision-making, developing or enhancing tools as necessary to collect it. Communication with traders, sales, clients and compliance officers about new feature requests, explanation of existing features etc. SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WE ARE LOOKING FOR Bachelors or Master's degree in computer science or engineering or equivalent experience Core Java Developer with 1-2 years of experience Experience of developing and managing high volume, distributed, real-time transaction processing systems Familiarity with Test Driven Development and Business Driven Development Experience with OO design, performant data structures and algorithms. Experience of databases (SQL, NoSQL) Linux / Unix skills including scripting (shell) Beneficial background knowledge/experience... Experience of sequencer/event-based architectures. Web development skills (Vert-x, NodeJS, etc). Knowledge of financial markets. ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world. We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers . We're committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https:// www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html © The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2021. All rights reserved. Job_Title: AIoT Research Scientist (Sustainability), Domain - Sustainability, Digital, Building Technologies, Carbon Capture and Air Quality

Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology.  As a leading IoT company, Bosch offers innovative solutions for smart homes, smart cities, connected mobility, and connected manufacturing.  It uses its expertise in sensor technology, software, and services, as well as its own IoT cloud, to offer its customers connected, cross-domain solutions from a single source.  The Bosch Group’s strategic objective is to deliver innovations for a connected life.  Bosch improves quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm.  In short, Bosch creates technologies that is “Invented for life.” About Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd is a regional subsidiary of the Bosch Group, representing the Group’s interests in Southeast Asia, where it is currently present in all ASEAN member countries. Job Description As part of BOSCH’s business expansion strategy, our Research Centre is seeking for a well experience AIoT Research Scientist (Sustainability) to join our team in Singapore office. In this role, you will drive local innovation to support the vision of Urban Solutions and Sustainability in Corporate Research Singapore, also in alignment with Bosch Global strategy in AIoT domain. You will evaluate the ecosystem in Singapore / ASEAN, co-create with business units in relation to sustainability initiatives, contribute to long-term product portfolio of Bosch, perform customer interviews, and formulate problem statements and generate research proposal. You will drive hands-on work AIoT Applications, sensor networks, communication protocols, data analytics, machine learning, laboratory activities, design of experiment for proof of concept and create prototypes. You will identify “Best-In-Class” within local institutions and universities for potential collaboration. In additional, you will conduct regular alignment with Strategic Portfolio Owner, quarterly review project update, stakeholder management, idea pitching via Bosch Innovation Framework. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a PhD or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Environmental Service or similar. Candidate with thesis or relevant experience related to Sustainability, Digital, Building Technologies, Carbon Capture and Air Quality will be highly appreciated. You should have minimum 3 years’ experience in performing at least 2 full-cycle AIoT research projects until prototypes, ideally with commercialization strategy, experience in applied IoT applications, data analytics. You should have high awareness of the latest technology trend with able to translate research effort into functional prototype, demonstrate to customers. You should have sound knowledge in sensor technology, method, system design and its application. You must have strong passion for innovation, possessing entrepreneurial spirit and with excellent writing and communication skills. You should be able to work independently and in a team. You must have good working attitude and be able to adapt in a dynamic environment

You will collaborate with SAP, digital application and data analysis teams to provide overall consultancy and solution to business. Company Description Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd is a regional subsidiary of the Bosch Group, representing the Group's interests in Southeast Asia where it is present in all ASEAN member countries. Business operations in these countries report to Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd, located in Singapore. Bosch has been present in Southeast Asia since 1919, with diversified businesses in the company's four business sectors - Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. Bosch's strategic objective is to improve quality of life with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm. In short, Bosch creates technology that is “ Invented for life. ” At Bosch, we care. For you, our business, and our environment. Let’s turn visions into reality. At Bosch,we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich people’s lives. Our areas of activity are every bit as diverse as our outstanding Bosch teams around the world. Their creativity is the key to innovation through connected living, mobility or industry. Our responsibility goes far beyond business. We’re independent of stock markets and bound to the purpose of the Robert Bosch Foundation; our success directly benefits society, the environment, and future generations. Our promise to our associates is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. Join in and feel the difference. Let’s be remarkable. Job Description As a robot engineer/researcher, the candidate will work on developing a new testbed towards automation in waste sorting. The candidate will assist in Development of the testbed to integrate sensors, robots, conveyor belts, controllers, etc. Programing and integrating industrial robots to perform tasks such as pick-n-drop. Development and maintenance of prototype applications based on controllers such as Raspberry Pi and Arduino Improving trajectory planning algorithms to ensure high throughput of operations such as pick-n-drop Closely communicate with other teams via emails and presentation slides Qualifications Undergraduate studies in related field of robot engineering Major in robotics from Mechanical and Aerospace Engineering or Electrical engineering and Computer Science

Manager FP&A Analytics About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities Standard Chartered ("The Bank") is a leading international bank operating in some of the most dynamic markets in the world, in Asia, Africa and the Middle East. This is a role within Group FPA Analytics team. The team provides MI and analytical support for the insight and analysis on the Bank's performance and the market environment to drive strategic decision making and support the communication of the Bank's performance to external stakeholders. The role provides an opportunity to interact directly with a range of senior management within Standard Chartered, develop a strong understanding of the Bank and its markets and to directly influence how the Bank is perceived by key external stakeholders such as investors and ratings agencies. The role suits an individual able to conceptualise, problem solve and think laterally to manage dynamic and unique issues. The individual should be fluent in reading bank financial statements and have good understanding of banking products, accounting methods and external disclosures. Creativity and the ability to communicate clearly are essential skills for the role. Key Roles & Responsibilities A leading role in the preparation, coordination and delivery of business performance analysis and insight to support multiple Group FP&A deliverables to Group Board and MT Responsible for providing insightful analysis on key performance indicators to support global performance management processes including: Net interest margin analytics and modelling Financial modelling for planning and forecasting, analysing the impact of external drivers on business performance Return frameworks including Franchise Economic Value Added ("EVA") analysis at the country, segment and client level Analysis supports regular Board reports, Group Management Team updates and Group Management Business Review ("MBR"). This role requires strong understanding of current financial and business performance drivers across all businesses and regions of the Group through regular engagement with business finance teams. Key point of contact within Group FP&A team for business finance and Treasury teams based in Singapore and in Asia time-zone. Form strong relationships with Asia-based internal stakeholders, both in finance and global functions. These typically include business/regional CFOs, FP&A teams, Treasury, Strategy and Investor Relations. Work closely with London and Chennai based FP&A teams to coordinate deliverables, ad hoc requests and communication with business finance teams. Regular briefing and knowledge sharing within team across locations on business performance themes. Deliver performance analysis to support key external reporting events including half and full year results and interim management statements. Support planning and forecasting processes with insight into business performance drivers including risks and opportunities to budget. Support Board and MT updates on Planning as appropriate. Work closely with process owners in Management Reporting and Planning to ensure analysis is timely, accurate and consistent with across FP&A outputs. Our Ideal Candidate The ideal candidate would have experience in FP&A, business finance, corporate strategy or investor relations with specific financial institutions experience with over 8 years. Prior experience in balance sheet management, capital and liquidity considered favourably. Strong analytical and strategic mindset. Experience in BI/visualization tools such as Tableau and/or scripting languages such as R/Python is preferred Good interpersonal and communications skills with stakeholders at all levels. High standard of written English, with the ability to review, summarise and communicate material accurately and succinctly. Able to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines while delivering quality output to senior management. CFA, CA or equivalent qualification is preferred but not essential. Excellent Excel and Powerpoint skills Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions. To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages . We welcome conversations on flexible working.

Company Description Bosch Security Solutions has an extensive product portfolio which includes video surveillance, intrusion detection, fire detection, voice alarm,  public announcement systems, professional audio and conferencing system as well as access control and management systems. It assists and supports its Singapore customer base with the designing, implementing and maintaining of projects. As part of Bosch expansion plan in the market, we are seeking for technical competent Service Technician to join our Singapore team. Job Description Your responsibilities include: Onsite technical support CCTV and card access technical support on field security equipment, coordinate and escort of third party vendor to facilitate rectification work First level support (Hardware) Backend server, workstation, card printing, network equipment Third party equipment such as turnstile, carpark barrier, flap barrier, road blocker, under vehicle surveillance system First level support (Software) PV-database, report generator, personalization of the card access, anti-virus, etc. Power shutdown standby and support Additions & Alternations work Relocation of door reader, adding of camera, etc. Qualifications Diploma, ITC or NTC in Electrical and Electronic or in relevant fields 1-3 years of working experience in CCTV and card access security equipment Experience in troubleshooting CCTV, card access security system, intruder detection system, carpark barrier. Work at height certification, boomlift driving certification Good in written and spoken English Good discipline in Electrical and Electronic practice Good customer service skill Additional Information KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS Service Level Agreement (2 hrs respond time and 2 hrs rectification time) Maintain customer satisfactory and support level .

Company Description About Bosch Group The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services, employing roughly 400,500 associates worldwide and generating sales of 78 billion euros in 2017 (preliminary figures). Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology.  As a leading IoT company, Bosch offers innovative solutions for smart homes, smart cities, connected mobility, and connected manufacturing.  It uses its expertise in sensor technology, software, and services, as well as its own IoT cloud, to offer its customers connected, cross-domain solutions from a single source.  The Bosch Group’s strategic objective is to deliver innovations for a connected life.  Bosch improves quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm.  In short, Bosch creates technologies that is “Invented for life.” About Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd is a regional subsidiary of the Bosch Group, representing the Group’s interests in Southeast Asia, where it is currently present in all ASEAN member countries. Job Description As part of our expansion plan in ASIA, we are seeking one position of Senior Software Engineer / Tech Lead to join our IOC team in Singapore. As a Senior Software Engineer, you will play a vital role in developing and transforming ideas to solutions that help our customers become successful. You will be responsible for the overall technical delivery of the solution and also does detailed technical design and hands-on delivery for the critical parts. Success in the role will be demonstrated by your ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. In this role, you will support the IoT Software Development projects for Bosch internal customers. You will design, develop and transform software solutions to products and suites around IoT with wider customers’ adoption, gather and analyses requirements and needs from business customers to integrate IoT solutions in Bosch products. You will achieve good quality software deliveries by adopting the most appropriate technical solutions; build, ship and run new software components in Cloud environments. You will provide mentorship to the junior developers in code craftsmanship and lead the technical team and being responsible for the overall technical delivery of the solution. In addition, you will work closely with the PM, PO, Architect and Engineering Manager, support with high level estimations and planning. You are also required to work with the QA team, triage and plan for the bug fixes required Qualifications To be successful for this role, you must have a Bachelor / Master Degree in Computer Engineering or other similar interdisciplinary courses with at least 8 to 10 years of professional experience in the field of software development activities such as requirements gathering/analysis, system analysis and design, implementation, and automation testing. You should be experienced in Java and frameworks like Spring Boot, Hibernate, Rest API etc. be proficient with UI development including HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, Angular/React, Node.JS etc You should have experience in real-time data streaming and event processing technologies.eg: Kafka and also worked with DevOps tools and CI/CD pipelines. Candidate with experience using Git, Jenkins, Maven or Gradle, Docker, Kubernetes will be an advantage. You should be skilled in working with relational and non-relational databases, cloud environments like AWS, Microsoft Azure etc. You should be competent in integrating with sensors, beacons etc and communication protocols like MQTT, AMQP, LoRaWAN , competent with agile development methodologies such as Scrum, Kanban, extreme programming etc. will be at critical desire. You should be a team player with effective communication skills to work in a culturally diversified team. You must have the capability to lead teams of 6-10 people for web and mobile applications. In additional, you should have very good understanding of iOS and Android development and release cycle.

Job Reference #242468BR Your team You will be working in our delivery team in Hong Kong or Singapore, and working together with the global IT team to provide robust and reliable IT services and solutions to help our clients to manage their assets and investments. Ability to effectively manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines. • Extensive experience in Developing, Executing and Maintaining Test Plan, Test Strategy, Test Scenarios and Test Cases and Reporting system. Job Description In AquaEasy (A Bosch Company), we transform aquaculture from art to science by connecting directly the farmers with the best aquaculture experts. Supported by a unique combination of sensors, artificial intelligence and automation, AquaEasy helps the farmers to make daily decisions, reduce risks and increase shrimp yields. Our Solutions and services include Health Management of Shrimps, Cost Management, Water Quality Management & Farm Management. As part of our business expansion, we are seeking one position of Ai Data Engineer for our Singapore office. In this role, you will be lead development data driven AI automation and systems and solutions for the company. You will build AI (Machine/Deep Learning) models to solve real world business challenges, be hands-on with research and development on identified problems. You will perform analysis and methods to the data, perform data collection, ETL and other necessary data transformation. You will perform data labeling when necessary and data visualization, BI reporting, when necessary. Candidate with prior knowledge in ML/DL is preferred but not required. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Business or Engineering with at least 3 years of equivalent practical experience. You should have good working knowledge and experience with data analysis and machine/deep learning models, working knowledge of data science, statistics and applied mathematics and working knowledge of modern software development principles. You must be able to do programming and analysis Python and/or Java. You must be self-motivated, independent and be proactive team player. You must have good communication and report writing skills. You must be hungry to learn and with ability to pick up new knowledge fast. You must be resourceful when it comes to problem solving. Guidance will be provided on the job, when necessary.

Job Description To sustain the fast and qualitative development progress in Bosch, we are seeking for a Senior Database Administrator for MS-SW to join our IT team in Singapore. In this role, you will be the subject matter expert of database structures, PowerBI setups and provide consultancy to customers and translates business needs into database/infrastructure requirements. You will create and deliver best-in-class database solutions that meets customer needs, coordinates and oversees installation of database solutions as needed. You will consults and supports the rollout of LIS (manufacturing plants) locations and creates and maintains documentation detailing technical design and processes. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or related area, or an equivalent combination of education, professional training and experience that provide the individual with the required knowledge, skills, and abilities. We require someone with at least 5 years of proven working experience in MSSQL Server Database Administration and software / database development experience.  You must have experience in Microsoft SQL 2012 to 2019 - installations, upgrades, and security patches, be competent in PowerBI, SSIS/SSRS/SSAS, Database infrastructure and architecture design, PowerShell scripting and database optimization and performance tuning. You must also be competent in Database HA setup, SQL Server Failover Cluster/AlwaysOn Availability Groups and experience with Performance Tuning and Optimization using native monitoring and troubleshooting tools. Some other key skills required for this role includes Backup/Recovery and Patching, Linux and Windows server experience, including Active Directory. You must be well verse in security hardening and CIS Compliance and able to work with peer DBAs and global teams located across the globe in different time zones. You must have great organizing skills with ability to  work independently and in teams. You must have ability to multi-task and context-switch effectively between different activities and teams and be familiarize with technical principles of disaster recovery and backup solutions, and data migration solutions of storage. Candidate with experience with Hybrid, Private or Private Cloud in Azure will be a great plus.

Job Description Our Bosch Security Solutions, a leading brand in Singapore with extensive range of products portfolio in the domain of video surveillance, intrusion detection, fire detection, voice alarm,  public announcement systems, professional audio and conferencing system as well as access control and management systems. Through the years, our products are well received by our Singapore based customers has collaborated with us through our design, implementation and maintenance projects. As part of BOSCH’s business expansion strategy, our Security Solutions Business Unit is seeking for a technical competent Senior Service Engineer to join our team in Singapore office. In this role, you will have team lead responsibilities and provide technical guidance to the team ensure smooth operation and discipline, policy and processes aligned. You will work closely with second level support engineer and to lead and resolving issue. Lead and provide instruction and direction to team members supporting daily field service activities. You will prioritize daily service and support work schedule and anticipate situation to ensure service level are not compromise. You will ensure key results are achieved or group of aligned results. You will ensure engineering discipline and SOP are properly followed and uphold customer satisfactory and support level. You will ensure no security risk compromise on our maintenance services to our clients. You must be able to work with pressure and be result oriented. You will ensure service report and service status from team member are updated to call center and coordinator timely. You must good interpersonal and communications skill with ability to manage and influence stakeholders. Software Engineer - Wealth Management Engineering ENGINEERING What We Do At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don't just make things - we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets . Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here. Who We Look For Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. The Consumer and Wealth Management (CWM) business provides end to end Investment Management services and advice across a large range of asset classes for high net worth individuals. CWM leverages a global technology platform offering, an integrated suite of tools, and applications to onboard clients. Our software helps realize a client's goals and objectives, develops and implements an integrated wealth management plan and delivers first-class client service. Within CWM, MSG (Market Solutions Group) provides customized advisory, structuring and execution services across asset classes to high net worth individuals and family offices, and manages structured investment and equity option strategies to complement client portfolios. How you will fulfill your potential Build a modern platform for trading OTC (Over the Counter) products using latest technologies and following industry standard SLDC processes Enhance OTC platform to support Crypto offerings Enable Open Architecture (OA) for OTC products by integrating with a vendor product for quotes and trades from external broker-dealers to provide best execution prices for our clients Interact directly with Portfolio Managers, Traders, Private Wealth Advisors (PWAs) to get exposure to business Watch your dev contributions positively impact firm revenue Preferred Qualifications Between 3-7 years industry experience in hands-on programming Strong Java skills and working in a Linux environment are a must. Experience developing and maintaining a real-time distributed system. Experience with Vertx, MongoDB, Kafka would be an advantage. Understanding of data structures (trees, hash maps, queues, etc.) Active GitHub and/or Stack Overflow profile would be great Bachelor's degree / Master's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world. We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers . Job Description In this role as a UC Service Manager & Consultant, you will be responsible for the following: Service Management for Avaya Communication Services in AP You will track, escalate and follow-up on operartion-related activities (Incidents/Changes/Requests) for the locations in AP.  You will also do requirement gathering, consultation and request tracking of Avaya contact centre service in AP BoschTube Livestream Consultation in AP You will provide consultation and support to Livestream events that are organised in AP Regional Consultation and Rollout coordination for Smart Meeting Room (SMR) in AP You will oversee the consultation with location owners for the setup of SMR in AP (Requirement gathering / Solution recommendation) and coordinate the rollout of the SMR solution for location (Preparation of the list of devices needed, Liaise with local PFP/FCM and contractors to setup the solution in the meeting rooms) Operational Management of Virtual Classroom Worldwide You will follow up with stakeholder (BTC) and vendor about operational-related activities (Incident,Change) for the service Product/Service Management for Avaya Phones You will be responsible for lifecycle management (evaluation/operation/replacement) of certified Avaya Phones (hard phones) for Avaya Communication in Bosch and be the main contact person to liaise with vendor and PSO for Avaya Communication Service for the service. For example: Teams/Skype/Avaya will be an added advantage.

Job_Title: Head of Legal and Compliance - CardsPal - SC  …
Job_Descriptions: Head of Legal and Compliance - CardsPal - SC Ventures About Standard Chartered We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East. To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. About CardsPal by Standard Chartered At CardsPal, we help you optimise your spending and maximise your savings. We are an all-in-1 credit card comparison app in Singapore that shows you how to make the most of your cards to get the maximum benefits. Personalise your money-saving experience based on the credit cards you own. We recommend you the best cards to use to earn the most cashback and rewards across multiple spending categories. Ready to take the next step in your career with us? To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good. We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base. The Role Responsibilities The Legal and Compliance Head is instrumental in enabling CardsPal in its operational and growth strategy. This role will be expected to lead the business in all aspects of legal and regulatory compliance advice, guidance and support and will collaborate closely with Standard Chartered Ventures (SCV). Strategy Responsible for establishing and maintaining strong governance of services and products. Understand the laws and regulations relating to CardsPal's business including, Fintech and Technology Law, digitization, data privacy, data sharing, corporate governance, licensing requirements, insolvency, and other laws applicable to the business. Develop, maintain and ensure the efficiency and effectiveness of the control framework for all relevant regulatory, operational and outsourced activities. Establish, enhance, and monitor compliance framework in business operations. Lead and support compliance matters and projects, including trend analysis, incident escalation and resolution report drafting, performing monitoring or assessment, and task management. Product development involvement from scratch, including effective working with commercial counterparts to go through process flows and understand the technology involved. Negotiate commercial agreements with partners to the business, clients or market participants. Engage, procure and manage external counsel support as and when required. Develop thought leadership capability within the industry. Advisory Work with the SC Ventures' CCO and Head of Legal to ensure compliance by CardsPal at all times with (i) relevant regulatory requirements, (ii) privacy laws, (iii) outsourcing requirements and (iv) any policies, standards and guidelines applicable to the CardsPal as approved by the board. Review product flows and development, whilst providing Legal & Regulatory Compliance insight and expertise on existing and developing business propositions. Lead negotiations with third parties, including technology contracts, trading agreements and partnership agreements. Providing guidance, advice, and/or training, to improve business' understanding of related laws and regulatory requirements. Maintain compliance documentation including obligations, business unit manuals, compliance notices/circulars, governance databases, risk assessments and compliance plans. Coordinate internal compliance review and monitoring activities, including periodic reviews of departments. Prepare and present clear and concise compliance reports to the Board. Draft intra-group services agreements, draft and negotiate client documentation. Secure and maintain original agreements. Risk Management and Governance Execute the relevant aspects of the Legal & Regulatory Compliance policies through robust independent risk control and the provision of specialist advice and constructive challenge in a manner proportionate to the nature, scale and complexity of CardsPal's business. Drive, through the Legal & Regulatory Compliance support, new product developments and product launches Provide input for the design of related controls and control monitoring and reporting at the local subsidiary. Establish and maintain strong governance of services and products Assure that Legal & Regulatory Compliance risks are identified and mitigated, or are raised and risk-accepted by SC Ventures and appropriate Legal & Regulatory Compliance templates are developed and used for dealings with third parties with adequate protections and remedies to address end to end product risks, and ensure that transactions with third parties are valid and enforceable under the laws of Singapore; Monitor the external environment for changes in law and regulations, shifting industry or market practices and litigation affecting the venture Participate in the Enterprise Risk Committee and manage issues involving product related legal, regulatory and reputational risks, Provide robust challenge to venture management and all relevant business stakeholders where activities are outside risk tolerance/ appetite, escalating as necessary, until appropriate oversight and ownership is achieved including actions and plans to address any remedial action needed to come back within risk tolerance/ appetite. Close cooperation with the SCV Corporate Secretariat in relation to governance of the company Regulatory & Business Conduct Display exemplary conduct, be aware of and live by the overall SCB Group's Values and Code of Conduct. Proactively support and challenge CardsPal to exhibit appropriate conduct, comply with regulatory and compliance requirements and strive to achieve fair outcome for CardsPal's clients and other stakeholders Take personal responsibility for embedding the highest standards of ethics, including regulatory and business conduct at CardsPal. This includes understanding and ensuring compliance with, in letter and spirit, all applicable laws, regulations, guidelines and the Group Code of Conduct of Standard Chartered Bank. Be prepared to qualify or register as a regulated person, if required. Effectively and collaboratively identify, escalate, mitigate and resolve risk, conduct and compliance matters. Our Ideal Candidate The successful candidate will be part of a start-up team building an innovative platform and app leveraging data, analytics to drive the business. This is a rare opportunity for a self-driven, strong entrepreneurial spirit, start-up minded, solid and passionate professional to join and contribute to a venture. Qualifications and Technical Knowledge Possesses core technical knowledge in laws and regulations applicable to the business including e-commerce, payments, e-wallet and data privacy Has a core grasp of the sales and transactional activities of the business, its operating model, and its key risks. Understanding of the relevant regulatory risks associated with the product. Core experience, shown by demonstrable achievements in the above areas. Minimum 8 years PQE. Qualified to practice in commonwealth jurisdiction, preferably Singapore. Experience in funding/ venture capital/e-Commerce is an advantage Analytical skills Ability to analyse relevant laws and regulations and correlate regulatory issues to products and business models. Ability to identify and articulate Legal & Regulatory Compliance issues, and to make clear decisions or recommendations on those issues. Communication and client management skills Core ability to ensure that relevant stakeholders receive relevant and timely information on developments impacting the business, including an ability to identify "horizon" risks and issues. Ability to lead discussions around complex problems with relevant stakeholders. Ability to drive the Legal & Regulatory Compliance agenda with the rest of the entity. Company Description About Bosch Group The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technology and services, employing roughly 400,500 associates worldwide and generating sales of 78 billion euros in 2017 (preliminary figures). Its operations are divided into four business sectors: Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology.  As a leading IoT company, Bosch offers innovative solutions for smart homes, smart cities, connected mobility, and connected manufacturing.  It uses its expertise in sensor technology, software, and services, as well as its own IoT cloud, to offer its customers connected, cross-domain solutions from a single source.  The Bosch Group’s strategic objective is to deliver innovations for a connected life.  Bosch improves quality of life worldwide with products and services that are innovative and spark enthusiasm.  In short, Bosch creates technologies that is “Invented for life.” About Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Robert Bosch (South East Asia) Pte Ltd is a regional subsidiary of the Bosch Group, representing the Group’s interests in Southeast Asia, where it is currently present in all ASEAN member countries. The company is active in all the company’s four business sectors of Mobility Solutions, Industrial Technology, Consumer Goods, and Energy and Building Technology. The Asia Pacific headquarters for its Automotive Aftermarket, Building Technology and Bosch Software Innovations businesses, as well as operations for Corporate Research and Advance Engineering, and Information Technology, are part of Robert Bosch (SEA) Pte Ltd. In Bosch, we are committed through our EVP ensuring all our associates to GROW , ENJOY and INSPIRE on their journey with us. Job Description We are looking for an experience Development Engineer – Cloud Frameworks & Automation to join our CI team in Singapore.  In this role, you will support the [email protected] and the Bosch Hybrid Cloud initiatives which involves development & automation of the Cloud Frameworks & Automation Product portfolio using state of the art Development Tools and frameworks. You will develop, enhance, and standardize development processes through automation: Envision, implement, and support cloud management solutions 3rd level support for in-house solutions Evangelist for next-gen software development practices and work with internal software developer communities This role requires both depth and breadth in technologies used in modern DevOps landscapes, PaaS platforms and the development of cloud-native application architectures (micro-services). Furthermore, a solid understanding of the components required to provide high-availability application and networking environment is required. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you must have a Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, Electrical / Electronics Engineer or with similar discipline with at least 5 years of experience in similar platform. You must have intermediate to expert level experience in programming and scripting languages – Java, (Spring Framework), Python, or Go etc. You must have experience in usage of software development environments (for e.g: Jenkins, Concourse, GIT, Gradle, Artifactory, Bitbucket etc.) .You must have basic knowledge of major IT Infrastructure Technologies (Container Technologies Docker, Kubernetes etc.,). You must have experience in the field of agile development and application operation in Cloud environments (DevOps). You must have excellent organizational skills, oral and written communication skills with willingness for continuous learning. You must have ability to work with minimal supervision, making decisions based upon priorities and schedule, team-, target oriented, ability to understand business initiatives and work independently. You must be flexible and willing to work under pressure (e.g. tight schedule). You should be analytical and equipped with problem-solving skills, self-motivated and proactive approach. You must be able to perform work in accordance with defined organization standards, demonstrate knowledge and experience.

Job Description As part of our expansion plan in ASIA, we are seeking one position of Product Owner to join our IOC team in Singapore. In this role, you will work with our great team to deliver the best software solutions to our innovative and industry-leading products. This role is ideal for someone with an entrepreneurial mindset and real-world experience distilling business value and goals into product vision and roadmaps. In this role, you will drive the vision, roadmap, strategy and requirements that meet the needs of our customers. You will set feature priorities and create the product roadmap to achieve product & team visions and bridge the gap between design and engineering by being the person responsible for communicating the design solutions to engineering in a clear and concise manner and ensuring projects are delivered on time as per specifications. You will be a voice of the customer and provide a business perspective on value during day-to-day development and lead, inspire UI/UX Designers and engineers to deliver excellent solutions that fit business/product goals while keeping technical constraints in mind. You will capture use cases from customers and solutions team, and help develop the feedback and iteration cycle and provide thought leadership on usability and user-centered design principles. You will Write detailed product specifications / requirements for both design and engineering. You will be responsible for planning, ongoing estimation, evaluation and reporting of expenses (scope, budget and time). Qualifications To be successful for this role, you must have a MBA / Bachelor Degree in Computer Science, IT, or Product Design preferred with at least 7 to 10 years building and managing a product end-to-end in collaboration with designers and engineers.  You should be experience in building B2B / Enterprise / SaaS platforms and with track record working very closely with designers and engineers on a breadth of projects. Experience with IoT Projects a plus. You should be experience leading via agile based methodologies and with ability to engage in technical discussions with engineering is required. You should be effective in your presentation, communications and interpersonal skills and with ability to build consensus, alignment, and relationships with diplomacy across teams with different goals, functions, and initiatives. You must be self-motivated, with a knack for strategic, technical, and creative problem-solving and be comfortable delivering product presentations to large audiences.

Job Description Our Corporate Human Resources Department is seeking a passionate Talent Acquisition Specialist (2 years contract) to join our team in Singapore office. Keen to know what we do in HR? Our work – with and for all „Boschlers“ shapes the transformation of Bosch enabling autonomy, mastery and purpose of people, teams and organizations. Taking “Invented for Life“ to a new era. Why join us? You will work alongside a dynamic and experience team in Singapore office, in your role. you have full empowerment to drive and lead the talent acquisition space. You will be responsible for the end-to-end recruitment process, including but not limited to compliant job posting, job sourcing, phone screens, assessment, candidate tracking and search updates. In addition, you will partner with the stakeholder in all interviews coordination and feedbacks. This position will have access to our Application Tracking System (Talenthub) which allows identification of candidate’s pipeline. You will be responsible to ensure diversity initiatives to attract a diverse workforce to the company. In this role, you have the chance to develop innovative recruiting programs to ensure that branding, marketing, and career events are align with overall Bosch EVP goals. A part of your capacity should focus on employer branding and TA projects with the target to bring Bosch to relevant social media platform, recruitment events, internal awareness roadshows of our Bosch EVP to support future candidate identification for future potential recruitment. You will work closely with communication teams to promote the organization’s employee value Proposition (EVP) and ensure consistent message through all levels in Singapore. Qualifications To be successful in this role, you ideally should have a diploma/degree holder with minimum 5 years of experience in end-to-end recruitment. Fresh graduates with a mind to enter talent acquisition function are welcome to apply. Savvy in managing application tracking system and social media platform. You come across as an individual with high energy, can-do attitude. Prior experience in participating career fair (virtual, onsite), social media hiring will give you added advantage. You need to posses good interpersonal and communications skills. Comfortable working with stakeholders of different level. Able to work autonomously and as part of a team.

Analyst Software Engineer - Fundamental Equity Goldman Sachs Asset Management Division: As one of the world's leading asset managers, our mission is to help our clients achieve their investment goals. To best serve our clients' diverse and evolving needs, we have built our business to be global, broad and diversified across asset classes, geographies and solutions. Fundamental Equity Technology supports the FE business unit in AMD. The business manages money for large institutional investors and runs several mutual and hedge funds spanning a broad spectrum of sophisticated Fundamental Equity securities and geographies. Fundamental Equity has extensive and growing global presence with key offices in New York, Singapore and Bengaluru. A great opportunity to work in a dynamic front office technology environment, partnering closely with the business to propose, design, develop, enhance and maintain technology solutions to drive the business. The candidate will participate in the entire software development life cycle from definition of requirements through development, deployment and support. The AMD Fundamental Equity business manages significant client assets by investing in global markets based on fundamental stock-picking strategies. The technology team works directly with a number of business groups including Portfolio Managers, Portfolio Implementation and Traders based in New York, Singapore, Japan, Hong Kong & India. You will collaborate with a global technology team to build applications that enable Portfolio Construction, Trading and Order Management. You will have the opportunity to work across the entire technology stack, delivering impactful and commercial products for our business. How Will You Fulfill Your Potential Full stack development with Angular, Java, NoSql Databases and Real Time Distributed Systems Build scalable services using the latest web & server-side technologies Build a unified world-class technology platform supporting all aspects of the investment process Work in challenging yet fulfilling environment which gives opportunity to work on critical projects to drive business growth Basic Qualifications 1+ years of software development experience Fluency in Java or other JVM language Angular JS, Java Script and UI technologies Solid analytical skills and appreciation of technical risk Strong team working and communication skills are essential to manage the business interaction and the global nature of projects Highly motivated, committed and capable of working to timeline Preferred Qualifications TypeScript/Angular SQL & NoSQL DB like Sybase, Mongo, ElasticSearch and other related technologies Strong team working and communication skills with desire to work on global projects with Tech team and aligned with a front-office trading desk. ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world. Job_Descriptions: Pricing Project Management Analyst - PMO (1 Year Contract) At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group’s global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today! Bank of Singapore opens doors to new opportunities. Start your career with Bank of Singapore as a Pricing Project Management Analyst! ! The Product Policies and Regulatory Management (PPRM) team encompasses a few verticals which support the Product Management Group (PMG) in various capacities including Policy Management. The policy management team creates and maintains policies and their associated governance meetings which are pivotal to the Bank. Some policies include (i) Sales Policy (ii) Best Execution (iii) Suitability Policy, (iv) PRR Policy and (v) Pricing Policy. These policies are crucial for the running of the entire private banking franchise. We are hiring for a temporary position (12 months) to support the operational intention of implementing the Pricing Policy. The incumbent is to support the policy owner in both the BAU responsibilities as well as change management of an existing implementation project. Responsibilities Alignment of Pricing Policy against regulations Define procedures required to ensure that policy can be operationalised Ensure coverage across various procedures to comply with policy Consider the level of control and monitoring expected to ensure compliance with policy Design solutions to address gaps identified, including business requirements for any additional system related implementations or enhancements Rollout Policy details Concentrated focus on gathering feedback for change, prioritisation of items, working through all details to make final proposal Engage all relevant stakeholders and user councils to assure adoption Identify potential pricing related topics for control monitoring BAU policy management: Organise Working Group and Committee meetings on regular basis Prepare agenda and slides for discussion and alignment Prepare meeting minutes Monitor and track action items to completion Facilitate completion of necessary docs for tabling for policy decisions Change Management of Pricing Project Support user testing and adoption of solution Support queries and collate feedback from users and track responses Coordinate project actions as necessary Qualifications Bachelors/Master's degree from a reputable university Minimum 5 years' experience in related industry, preferably with a focus on pricing, risk management, regulatory compliance topics Project management skills Stakeholder management skills You are a driven self-starter who is delivery focused and possess strong communication, influencing and presentation skills. You are future oriented and have the passion of introducing changes to the organization. You possess strong problem-solving skills and an analytical mind set. You are tech-savvy, minimally good PowerPoint, Excel, word processing skills You are well organized and can work independently.
