Job_Title: Credit Risk Associate, Traded Credit Risk
Job_Descriptions: The Singapore team is looking for an Associate hire to join their Credit Risk department. Reporting to the Chief Risk Officer, you will be part of a team providing expertise in credit risk management of a distinct portfolio of predominantly APAC financial institutions counterparties (country or sector) to ensure they remain within the bank's appetite and minimise credit losses. You will also be given exposure to provide Traded Credit Risk management support for deal clearance requests from Trading & Sales. Role and responsibilities Build and maintain strong relationships with Trading & Sales acting as an enabler with business partners, seeking to find solutions to proposals Demonstrate sound credit judgement in analysis and approval/decline (if required) as part of the annual review process, new transactions and/or excess approvals, reflecting understanding of pertinent issues and risk drivers and in line with delegated authority Proactively manage the credit risk profile of the APAC credit portfolio and ensure that risks are identified, assessed and mitigated to the desired level Identify problem cases, taking action to mitigate risk and ensuring that the appropriate internal governance is followed Provide expert support and advice to the business on the management of the credit risks in the APAC FI portfolio, including interpreting and complying with the relevant risk policy standards and risk management framework, and sharing relevant information as appropriate, g. regarding changes in risk appetite, emerging trends, potential threats and opportunities. Assist senior credit managers to ensure timely and productive kick-off meetings are held with offshore support teams / analysts. Review financial analysis provided by Credit Analysts; providing constructive feedback and coaching, as appropriate, to ensure required standards are met Participate in client due diligence meetings as appropriate / required Maximise cost effective efficiency through contribution to the change agenda, constructive challenge and improving processes Contribute to the development of a 'team working' ethos, take responsibility for own personal development and pro-actively support the team with development where appropriate Act as cover for the Traded Credit Risk Management function by providing timely and accurate credit figures for live deal clearance to Sales and Trading, including providing or facilitating approvals where required Assist the Excess Management team in analysing credit risk breaches Key requirements Credit risk analysis experience (minimum 2 years experience), preferably covering financial institutions Knowledge of key risks in Traded products (e.g. FX, interest rate swaps, Repo, Options) and associated key documentation terms and agreements used Have the ability to work independently with minimum supervision and exhibiting a positive "can do' attitude and willingness to broaden horizons outside of core credit competency required. This includes embracing the integrated (Credit, Market, Operational Risk & Traded Credit Risk Management) operating model for Risk in APAC Have a take ownership and following up mindset and able to work successfully as part of a team and with senior management Bachelor/Masters degree or equivalent professional qualification. Job_Title: SVP / VP, Enterprise Agile Coach, Transformation Group  - "[WD20174]
Job_Descriptions: About the Transformation Group Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the “World’s Best Bank” (Euromoney 2018, 2019 and 2020). Our approach is a combination of both science and art. We immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our innovation pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play.  We are passionate and committed to making banking joyful (while having lots of fun)! Job Purpose As the Enterprise Agile Coach, you will have a proven track-record of transforming large enterprises (both Business and IT) to adopt Agile and enable a continuous flow of value by embedding Agile friendly operating models and supporting enablers (e.g. Agile demand management & funding). You will be comfortable with dealing with C-level stakeholders to articulate, influence and coach how we build, and the way we build to address organisational challenges and pain points. In an effort to help deliver business value faster through expert timely intervention and capability development, the role is to enable teams to high performance across the platforms and solve problems using DBS Agile Way of Working by removing systemic blockers. Key Accountabilities The position is accountable for driving enterprise agility through org design, the uplifting capability of the DBS group teams in Agile values, principles and practices for the planning and execution of business value in relation to coaching, mentoring & educating and has the following accountabilities: Being a trusted advisor to senior management: Coach and develop all levels of staff on how to implement and sustain the Agile principles & practices Lead by example and seen as a role model of Agile values, principles and practices Establish a position as an expert in delivery that cultivates business value & risk mitigation Engage senior management and promote business strategies and solutions which drive an Agile culture and make value visible Leverage DBS Group resources to develop a robust-closed-loop policy / strategy deployment process that will strengthen the understanding of strategic direction and provide the goals required to cultivate a business value driven culture Execute the Divisional execution of Platform (IT & Business) strategy for customer  & employee benefit Plan an approach to incorporate Agile WoW the strategic oversight of the customers’ technology investment and assets Collaborate to ensure engagement and support for Agile strategy Work closely with other divisions (e.g. Technology, Finance, Risk etc,) to deliver quality outcomes Demonstrate a high level of strategic and tactical business acumen and industry knowledge in order to facilitate solution development taking into account expertise in Agile and other related disciplines. Cultivate ”how” to be value-driven and flexible in the way we think and behave – not just “do” such us stand ups  and iterations Implement the Divisional strategy Provide thought leadership to ensure successful design and implementation of delivery strategies that align with business unit, corporate goals and strategies Provide coaching advice to leaders at all levels in analysing business value and delivering well considered solutions Act as a trusted adviser to the business by driving innovative thinking with uncertainty & complex bodies of work Collaborate with other Divisions to ensure long term alignment to enterprise strategy Planning and Monitoring Collaborate with internal business customers and IT departments to ensure engagement and support for strategies Illustrate why Agile is in line with the nature of knowledge work by highlighting day to day inefficiencies that result from applying traditional mind-set to knowledge work Support the business in identification of business benefit and value, tangible and intangible, for initiatives raised. Work with leadership teams to gather business data, perform business analysis and identify key drivers for success Drive efficiencies within DBS through proactive sponsorship of improvement initiatives Balance between the needs of classical project management like answering the question “What will I get, when and for how much “without jeopardising the agility of the project and its ability to welcome change Develop the capability of others through effective mentoring, coaching, professional development Develop a culture that supports team engagement and high performance Deliver Just In Time training on Agile to DBS employees at all levels Develop and deliver Job Instruction Training (using the Tell – Show – Do method) to other Agile practitioners within DBS (including partners) Provide coaching, mentoring and professional development opportunities for those being coached and mentored on Agile WoW Teach organisation to understand the difference between the Agile mindset (“Being Agile) and Agile Practices (“Doing Agile”) and the characteristics needed in individuals, teams and organisations to embrace, promote & manifest the mindset of agility Create a team environment which is seen as an attractive career destination for internal and external candidates Support internal Guilds/Community of Practices Job Duties & Responsibilities Develop and define enterprise business agility roadmap, set the business agility agenda and implementation plan with clear business outcomes, e.g., business value delivery and time to market Define and implement metrics and performance indicators around business agility that will drive the success of the initiative Engage senior management and stakeholders to secure buy-in and support for business agility agenda and participate in forums to propagate and promote business agility Bridge business and technology by building a business agility culture that unifies, manages and resolves conflicts Understand enterprise technology landscape and drive business agility agenda that leverages on tech partnership Provide insight and guidance on enterprise/portfolio/project tech strategy that will support business agility agenda Identify and manage issues and risks, escalate issues as needed, and provide regular progress updates to senior management Required Experience You will have a track-record of establishing the models for commercials, governance, funding, organisational change and underlying delivery organisation, necessary to achieve an effective Agile enterprise; Proven hands on experience working with Agile & Lean Software development practices, and change management are essential i.e. able to do what you teach/coach others; At least  years’ experience in Agile Coaching roles, where you have transformed from traditional ways-of-working, and/ or recovered a troubled Agile transformation at the enterprise level; At least 7 years’ experience in Agile software development methodologies, values, principles and practices; At least 7 years’ experience in coaching, team building and group facilitation At least 7 years’ experience in Scrum, SAFE, DevOps, Kanban, Lean and of Systems Thinking; Strong customer focus: skilled ability to interpret and analyse customer requirements; influence design solutions in-line with Corporate and IT strategy; utilise established internal and external networks to promote innovative solutions for customers; Strong people leadership experience and a proven track record in leading high performing teams; Excellent presentation and written communication skills; Expert relationship management skills; ability to communicate well with diverse stakeholder groups through internal consultation & facilitation; Ability to work independently; Skilled ability to contribute to and understand strategic perspectives, and translate to tactical actions; Flexibility and resilience in responding to multiple changing priorities, and comfortable handling complexity and uncertainty; Systematic and disciplined approach to planning, organising, decision making and delegation; Skilled ability to work in a dynamic leadership team, contributing to the overall goals of the group; Skilled ability to perform synthesis and analysis working at the conceptual level for problem solving. Essential Qualifications: University degree in Business, Information Technology or related discipline (Mandatory) or equivalent industry related experience Certified Scrum Master (CSM) Desired Qualifications: Industry Association or Discipline Association Membership well regarded. ICAgile certification

OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world’s most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody’s. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World’s Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Job Reference #242069BR Your team You'll be working in the AML transaction monitoring team in Singapore. We're responsible for preventing and managing transaction compliance and risk. As an AML transaction monitoring specialist, you'll play an important role in making sure we create an environment where circumventing AML regulations and fraud is difficult to perpetrate and liable to detection at the earliest opportunity in order to protect our clients, assets, and services and reputation of the UBS brand. We are the 2nd Line of defense to ensure our client transactions are not linked to or used for money laundering or terrorist financing and to meet regulatory expectations in each of the jurisdictions that we operate in. Your expertise • ideally 1-3 years of previous experience in AML risk management & investigations, audit or compliance • prior experience in transaction monitoring is preferred • good understanding of the Wealth Management / Private Banking industry is preferred • hands-on experience using monitoring systems, including Actimize or Fortent • experience interacting with the middle and front offices to minimize and resolve risks • proficient with MS Office, particularly Excel and Access • good communication and interpersonal skills • meticulous and strong analytical skills • adaptable and organized with a positive can-do attitude • self-motivator and starter who can work independently About us UBS is the world's largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors. With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us? Join us From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, at UBS we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we're more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact? Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce. Employees working from UBS Singapore offices must comply with Workforce Vaccination Measures as implemented by the Singapore government with effect from 1 January 2022, and other applicable safe management measures as may be amended from time to time.

Job_Descriptions: Site Reliability Engineer, Group Consumer Banking and Big Data Analytics Technology, Technology & Operations - (WD29025) Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. Job Purpose Working with our business units, development teams, and many other units to help maintain the high quality and service level objectives of our systems. Optimize the supportability of systems through automation and applying basic SRE principles such as blameless post-mortem, error budget, and automation. Provide production support for the application domain when applicable. Key Accountabilities Manage, monitor and operate the system to ensure all business functions are running smoothly. Work across teams to continually review, provide feedback, implement best practices to improve the efficiency of the systems and drive future innovation. Job_Title: VP/AVP, Climate Risk Stress Testing Specialist,  …
Job_Descriptions: VP/AVP, Climate Risk Stress Testing Specialist, Risk Management Group Business Function Risk Management Group works closely with our business partners to manage the bank's risk exposure by balancing its objective to maximise returns against an acceptable risk profile. We partner with origination teams to provide financing, investments and hedging opportunities to our customers. To manage risk effectively and run a successful business, we invest significantly in our people and infrastructure. The team is responsible for regulatory & portfolio stress testing and general provisioning under IFRS9, including model development, execution, reporting and stakeholder management. This strategically critical role will assume ownership of the execution of Climate Risk stress tests, with a focus on expected credit losses and capital demand. Responsibilities Assess industry practices and regulatory expectations to contribute to the development of in-house climate risk stress testing capabilities and approaches covering transition / physical risks Conduct assessment of climate risk scenarios, focusing primarily on the execution of stress tests and translation of climate risk scenarios/ macroeconomic forecasts to credit risk projections Generation of IFRS 9 ECLs (GP and SP), NPAs and/or regulatory credit risk capital demand (RWA and EL) projections across the entire Group's credit portfolio in head office, branches, and subsidiaries. Generate reports for climate risk stress tests, including committee submissions and regulatory templates Conduct in depth analysis / deep dives of climate risk stress test results to identify and explain trends Coordinate and work across key stakeholders in IRB modelling, risk data, risk architecture and technology teams to develop and mange end-to-end stress testing processes Collaborate with locations to support the delivery of supervisory climate risk stress testing exercises as they emerge Explore and experiment with alternative modelling approaches for climate risk stress testing, including modification of existing stress testing models and approaches Support other internal and regulatory stress testing exercises Make active contributions to improving existing stress testing processes Requirements Prior engagement in climate-related workstreams and other risk areas strongly desired Hands-on experience with stress testing or IFRS 9 ECL preferred, particularly climate risk stress testing Solid understanding of Basel, MAS and HKMA supervisory requirements, including increasing expectations on climate risk stress testing Understanding of Basel IRB models, Stress Testing and/ or IFRS9 models and approaches Knowledge of credit process and business products Excellent programming skills in SAS, Python, Spark, R or other advanced languages; experience working with large and complex datasets Strong team player with good stakeholder management skills Excellent level of verbal communication, writing and presentation skills University graduate or post-graduate with major in Finance, Statistics, or other quantitative discipline Minimum 5-7 years of relevant experience in areas described above Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

What you will do Reporting directly to the APAC Vice President, Project Delivery and Performance Infrastructure, the Program Director- Renewable Energy and Sustainability, will plan, direct, and execute all efforts to achieve long-term growth through renewable energy project development, partnership, alliances and acquisition opportunities. The Program Director Renewable Energy and Sustainability, will be working across disciplines on large, complex projects in Solar, Energy Storage and potentially other renewable energy projects and technology. The Program Director will evaluate technical and commercial risk by market and for each project and find mitigations to preserve business value. Knowledge of the financial models used to originate and finance these type of projects is essential. How you will do it Strategic Planning and Execution: Support the Company's renewable energy growth strategy through identification, planning and assessment, and execution of project development pipelines, strategic partnerships, alliances and acquisition opportunities Create and cultivate a pipeline of market and country specific greenfield projects Participate directly in the origination and development of large scale renewable energy projects Structure and negotiate partnerships that provide the opportunity for strategic investment or acquisition in growth Maintain a deep knowledge of renewable energy industry intelligence and emerging trends, serving as an advisor to internal Executive Management Team and external stakeholders Commercial and Management: Develop and maintain detailed project, country and consolidated function financial budgets Assess various business models and suggest those which best meet Regional and corporate financial goals Drive strategy realization and achievement of business growth goals through sustainable execution practices, team building and client focus. Technical: Provide technical and project development oversight of new alternative energy opportunities including evaluating broad renewable business opportunities, provide direction and goals to the advanced solutions engineering team. Experienced in the technical and commercial data aspects of Renewable Energy projects where provided by clients early in the sales process. Additional tasks include but are not limited to: Managing advanced contracts and deal structures, business documents (e.g. NDAs) Deal structure analysis and preforms at the project level Direct origination of large scale projects Coordinating internally with the business development and technical diligence teams What we look for Master of Business Administration (MBA), or Masters in Engineering, Project Management or Energy Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Science, or a technical field relevant to renewable energy OR sustainability 15 years of experience Project Development, including complex power marketing and origination experience, in the energy field (direct experience with renewable energy at some point in your career is required) Experience managing large, diverse and geographically dispersed teams and staff, including demonstration of accomplishment in recruiting, growing and retaining a top tier team and function Proven success in large scale and large volume project development covering the entire lifecycle of a project Demonstrated excellent quantitative skills, understanding of project finance and its role in successful energy projects in Asia Pacific. Demonstrated success in working with Project and Corporate Finance functions to develop successful projects Ability to understand all related commercial and contractual requirements for renewable energy projects, and previous success in partnering internally with the legal and finance functions Track record of multiple markets experience and success, managing diversity in teams and geographies

Digital Qualifications Development Manager - Digital Capability Center What You'll Work With Apply Now You will be working as primary Knowledge Expert to lead McKinsey’s Digital Capability Center (DCC) in Singapore. The DCC is a cutting-edge Industry 4.0 center of excellence, set up in partnership with the Advanced Remanufacturing and Technology Center (ARTC). You will be the point-person for development of new content / knowledge at Digital Capability Center (DCC). In this role you will work with McKinsey leadership to fulfil the DCC’s 5-pronged mission to 1) showcase our center the realm of the possibilities for Industry 4.0 along the value chain, in particular production (discrete and hyper-personalized manufacturing lines), supply chain (supply chain control tower) and procurement (digital war room); 2) launch our capability building center and enable it to host companies in the region and worldwide, physically or virtually, in partnership with our other centers; 3) provide delivery center developing diagnostic tools, I4.0 kits and know-how for deployment during tech-enabled consultancy services; 4) be a pro-active ecosystem orchestrator in partnership with technology and service providers to help companies successfully implement Industry 4.0; 5) run a testbed for innovation, leveraging ARTC’s R&D capabilities You will ensure our team of Knowledge Analysts and IOT engineers are deployed across all dimensions to push our capabilities forward. Where required, you will work with experts from specific practices (Digital, Analytics, Design, Operations) and our global DCC network to build the knowledge at DCC Singapore You will support client development by helping visiting McKinsey client service teams articulate project proposals relative to Industry 4.0, leveraging the DCC facilities. You will be staffed on client engagements in a Content Director (CD) or Expert role – these client engagements will be related to Industry 4.0 diagnostics, pilots and full-implementation. You’ll work directly with clients – usually on site – and will work with teams on the ground to deliver the end products to clients. You will make an important contribution to the analysis, design, and implementation of business performance approaches, developing tailor-made solutions and working closely with clients to ensure positive impact and sustainable results. You will have the opportunity to build on your proven leadership skills and leverage your interest in inspiring others, building strong relationships, and creating a true followership. In a collaborative team setting, you'll work closely with others but also autonomously with little direction. Your superior analytical, quantitative and conceptual thinking skills and strong interpersonal and communication skills will ensure successful client projects and team performance. What You'll Do Bachelor’s engineering degree; Advanced degree or MBA is preferred Solid knowledge of Lean principles/tools and implementation of at least some I4.0 technologies (IIOT, analytics, robotics, 3D printing) in one or several relevant industrial sectors (discrete manufacturing, process industry, FMCG, oil & gas) Proven record of high performance and substantial achievements in your past positions Excellent oral communication and facilitation skills, including presentation Willing to work in a highly demanding and result-oriented team environment Strong conceptual and analytical problem-solving skills Ability to dealing with ambiguity and leverage a combination of data, experience and insight to quickly shape solutions from uncertainty Excellent project management skills Authorization to work in Singapore

Job_Title: Global Transaction Services Techno Senior Business  …
Job_Descriptions: Global Transaction Services Techno Senior Business Analyst The role will be part of the Global Transaction Services Technology (GTST) APAC team. GTST is a technology service delivery organization supporting the Global Banking and Markets business in Asia Pacific. The Bank is embarking on a multi-year core banking transformation journey to replace its legacy core banking platform with modern technology platforms. As part of the core banking platform transformation, the bank will seek opportunities to revamp & improve its end to end ecosystem to improve operational & technological efficiency. The core banking platforms support multiple functions in Global Banking and Markets business: e.g. payments, deposits, credit, trade finance, foreign exchange, general ledger. The candidate will be a senior product and techno-functional expert, and will play a leadership role in the banking transformation program. He/She will work with product teams, technical leads, and vendor SMEs for a given work stream (e.g. payments, trade finance) under the core banking transformation program and will have direct accountability in ensuring that business requirements for the work stream are designed and implemented as per expectation. The role is expected to build a deep understanding of the core banking platform and the capability it offers, and play a leadership role in solution ideation, design, and delivery. The role is required to work closely with business, operations, vendor partners and various peer groups/stakeholders in technology. The Position: Work with business, operations, and technology teams to gather requirements and recommend the optimal way to implement the solution in the product. Organize/Facilitate vendor demos to evaluate tools and solutions that may be adopted. Provide leadership and guidance on functional and technical aspects of the solution. Leverage domain and product expertise to set direction and drive project execution. Foresee and proactively address risks, issues, and dependencies. Act as the liaison between vendor and internal teams on requirements and oversee their end-to-end implementation. Manage user queries during feature implementation, and ensure that they are tracked and closed. Participate in system design, SIT, and UAT to ensure that solutions are being delivered and tested as per requirements. Ensure knowledge sharing and training on new product features. Recommend and implement data migration and integration strategies. Develop the Day-1 Operating model and support its implementation post go live. The Candidate: Essential Skills (Technical / Business Domain / Managerial/ Soft skills) Sound knowledge of the Wholesale Banking domain: e.g. deposits, payments, receivables, liquidity management, trade finance, commercial loans, credit management, FX. Experience in Core Banking transformation, and in designing core banking solutions that fit into a complex product ecosystem. Experience working with product and service vendors, and with the onshore-offshore delivery model. Ability to drive senior level discussions with good presentation and communication skills. Ability to influence & work with regional and global partners/stakeholders to drive the program forward. Execution and result oriented. Aptitude for critical thinking, problem solving, and decision-making. Desired Skills (Technical / Domain / Managerial/ Language Skills) Finacle implementation expertise. Knowledge of Finacle Core modules and the Finacle data model. Knowledge of Finacle Scripting and Finacle Workflows. Familiarity with Asia Banking market practices For more information you can email Duncan Gage in our Singapore office on Duncan.gage@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference 523619 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/96S9x4/global-transaction-services-techno-senior-business-analyst-itcommunications-singapore-singapore-14463422 Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA Licence No. 10C4544

Job_Title: VP, Intelligent Bank Product Manager, Consumer Banking Group (WD25083)
Job_Descriptions: Job Description VP, Intelligent Bank Product Manager, Consumer Banking Group - (WD25083) Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business - they were made just right for you. The Intelligent Bank team is focused on defining and implementing 'what's next' for DBS after digital, utilising our years of investment in digital capabilities, UX, and real-time customer data, with the objective of creating personalised, relevant, intuitive and meaningful experiences for our customers.We are focused on learning and understanding our customers' needs, behaviours, motivations and emotions. We explore and discover through customer immersions, experimentation and data. Customer and data insights drives everything we do, from product strategy to design, implementation, go live, and driving results. We work in collaborative, cross-functional squads to solve problems practically, craft and build experiences that will 'wow' our customers. Job_Title: AVP / SnrAssoc, SRE Engineer, EASRE, Technology and Operations - (WD29098)
Job_Descriptions: AVP / SnrAssoc, SRE Engineer, EASRE, Technology and Operations - (WD29098) Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. Key Responsibilities Drive the Site Reliability Engineering agenda forward at an Enterprise Level to improve availability, reliability, and performance of services. Drive cross-team efforts in resiliency assessment exercises and reporting Draft and/or contribute to internal SRE training materials Support services before they go live through activities such as Chaos testing (failure injection), system design inputs, developing software platforms and frameworks, capacity planning and launch reviews. Engage with product engineering teams to test against relevant Chaos Engineering tool kit. Sounds understanding of CI/CD pipelines and SDLC (application delivery) Assist application teams in setting up SLI, SLO and Error budget for the system/s Participate in Blameless Incident Retrospectives and follow up on action items Work with application teams for Observability, automating monitoring and auto-remediation of known issues. Programming and scripting to automate failure scenarios, integration with pipelines and developing self-service portals. Work with teams located across locations in Asia Pacific Skills and Experience Experience in SRE transformation and adoption for large scale environments Experience in one or more of the following: Java Script, Java and Python. Very good analytical and problem-solving skills with good understanding of technical risks emerging out of architecture decisions. Experience with developing applications and setting up automations in a Linux environment, with sound knowledge of algorithms, data structures, complexity analysis and software design. Understands complex architectures and well versed with design patterns. Development skills with experience in real time, distributed and highly secured environments. Experience with developing test cases and ensuring appropriate test coverage through unit and automated testing. Experience with one of more of ELK, Grafana, Prometheus, Dynatrace and AppDynamics. Experience with Proxies and Load Balancers like HAProxy and Nginix. Experience with CI/CD pipelines and release strategies Understands key SRE concepts such as Error Budgets, MTTD, MTTR and Launch Control Systematic problem-solving approach coupled with effective communication skills and a sense of ownership and drive. Ability to debug and optimize code and to automate routine tasks. Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field that involves programming, or equivalent practical experience. Minimum of 10 years technology experience (preferably in the financial industry). Highly motivated, pro-active and capable of working under pressure without compromising development processes and productivity. Strong, committed and reliable team player, able to take direction but also willing to contribute to discussions on design and strategy. Possess strong interpersonal and communication skills to be able to deal with and form good relationships with the business and other technology groups through day to day support and project work Interest in financial technologies, new technology tools and the ability to learn. Job_Title: Senior Associate, Strategic Projects Hong Kong Lending Project Manager (WD29846)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function The Institutional Banking Group provides corporate customers with a full range of commercial banking products and services, including cash management services, current accounts, time deposits, trade finance, working capital finance, term loans and foreign exchange. Through our continued commitment, DBS has cultivated long-standing relationships with its customers in the region that are based on account relationship management, service differentiation, product development and rigorous credit standards. Responsibilities Obtain a clear understanding the scope and business objectives of SME regional lending and the regional playbook standard of workflows to granular level of details, so that learnings and best practices can be shared with local country. Analyse and gain deep knowledge of end to end business lending processes and objectives for unsecured loans, secured loans, trade, FX, etc. in local country, and ideate and recommend controls and design workflows to improve current productivity and efficiency and flow, to reduce manual errors and improve turnaround time. Define project requirements and breakdown complex issues into well defined project milestones and phases, and proactively monitor progress by tracking activities, and delegate clear tasks to local programme manager, Business Analysts and Testers. Play a governance role in ensuring that the design in terms of the workflow, data flows and process steps are harmonized and consistent with lending strategy. Collate and rationalize all stakeholders' requirements, and walkthrough these requirements with stakeholders, including users, technology, UIUX designers, etc.. Provide regular, structured reporting and status updates to all impacted stakeholders and senior management, highlighting any key risks or issues. Independently drive stakeholder meetings with clear communication and meeting objectives, to resolve differing ideas and reach consensus on solution to implement. Requirements: Prior experience as a Program/Project Manager in Front Office/IT for SME banking for corporate lending and onboarding products is strongly preferred. Preferable to have minimum of 5-7 years work experience in Program Manager/Project Manager roles in Banking Market and business knowledge in SME Banking, familiarization with SME customer needs and internal business processes for lending and account opening is preferred. Project Management and Digital Implementation Experience Strong stakeholder management and communication skills, proven track record in managing stakeholders Able to adapt quickly and work in a fast paced environment, and systematically breakdown complex issues into well-structured solutions that are thought through end to end. Good understanding of the lending business and processes, from loan origination and application to disbursement, and account application to creation. Highly meticulous, detailed and logical in thought processes and clear and articulate communication skills, strong process improvement and strategic thinking skills Good understanding of the Digital & SME competitor landscape Awareness of Project management tools and methodologies like AGILE, JIRA, Confluence, etc. Able to work independently and as part of a team squad, and be extremely organized with strong time management skills Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.
